-GJ46IwshieFFZipx-gtgg.text: SO delicious!! I had Manocotti and my husband had a special pasta. No alcohol served but you can byob which we were sadly unaware of. Also they are cash only no cards.

IGldUXb8flYAihIw04sgHA.text: Amazing authentic Italian food!! My boyfriend and I always make sure to go when we're in the area. Their Baked Ziti is to die for!!!

kOszm8H8Z4taHQUYWFCqGg.text: We brought the entire family to Giuseppe's last night for a pre-Thanksgiving meal... yes, that's right - my family likes to carb up for all of the eating we do today!  We brought a ton of wine and had a great time.  Franco was our waiter - and I'm guessing since all the ladies at the table had a crush on him, that he is the waiter Sheila B wrote about in her review too.  Nice eye candy!  I absolutely love the eggplant rollatini and pretty much order it every visit.  We usually start with a Giuseppe's Salad and finish with a dessert to share.  My favorite is the white chocolate tartufa.  Pasquale (pictured above) is the sweetest man and makes the experience extra special every single time.    Since I'm writing this review on Thanksgiving, I want to give thanks to Pasquale and Ristorant Giuseppe for all the good times I've had there and all of the good times to come!  Salud!

5hDblOgyWW_OhAwEOKeE8Q.text: The service was great and the staff included was friendly. I wasn't too impressed with the food whatsoever and it was more like dining at a Peter piper pizza. I wouldn't recommend coming here. The food was average and the atmosphere wasn't too inviting. In addition It was extremely hot inside the restaurant.

L1TKpmkCWFV_VDkhYg0FGg.text: We have made Ristorante Giuseppe a weekly event.  The food is excellent;  the owner and his associates are delightful.  It is always difficult to choose an entree--they are all so good.  This evening we enjoyed a garbanzo bean salad, followed by eggplant parmigiana.  There was more than the two of us could finish.  Also--no corkage fee!  Always a delightful experience.  Thank you again.

rkL6cenOHOFGYybIA1qTNg.text: I've been to Giuseppe's many times since living in AZ for the last 20 years. My family and I just recently went there to celebrate our March Birthday Extravaganza!  I wish I took pics of the food but was distracted.  We brought wine, cash and presents.  When you walk in the door Giuseppe himself welcomes you and gives you a hug.  He does know some of us but I have a feeling that's how he treats everyone.  I grew up eating homemade sauce and pasta so we're very picky about Italian Food.  Giuseppe's passes the test.  I know different regions in Italy cook different styles of food, so I think Giuseppe definitely came from the same region as my Grandmother and her father.  Waiters-friendly and warm.  Food-fresh and delectable. Atmosphere-homey.

a3Wqk6XB6YKakdZwkmYeIw.text: Moved from Chicago to AZ and have been desperately looking   for good Italian food. This is not good Italian food. It is AMAZING!!!!!  And yes, They do have a really good meatball. Hands down the best!  I can't even tell you how wonderful the homemade desserts are!!!  Prices are great and service was impeccable. Love the family here that makes this place awesome.

Gf9dqbIYbeFIRmVGdBB1qA.text: Our favorite pasta place.  The fresh pasta is amazing.  I always get linguine and clams because it's fantastic.  Small salad and bread make for a perfect meal every time.

IiV2aP4ffBqj2Cy2P8ckfw.text: The website (giuseppescottsdale.com/o...) says the hours are ... M-F 11am to 8:30pm, Sat 5pm to 9pm, and Sun 5pm to 8pm. The sign on the door said Open on one side and Closed on the other side that hangs from a chain. Today I stopped by at 2:30pm and the Open side of the sign was displayed. When I got to the door, I was met by someone and not allowed in. I was told the business was closed and they don't open until 5pm, then had the door closed abruptly. I was made to feel very unwelcome and unwanted. I'm not sure why a business would treat customers or potential customers this way. If you changed your hours, why not change the sign on your door and update your website. The owner could have also been pleasant to me.

0eYrhWlgzBq5rKkvqf_eGw.text: I give this place 5 stars! I am only sad that it took me over 5 yearsof living here to find it. The Pasta Cardinale is my favorite pasta dish of all time! They offer BYOB with no corkage fee and service is great!  Great family owned restaurant and the owner is as nice as could be. Highly recommend!  One thing to keep in mind is that it is cash only.

cHTNjTTp9kYJXKn81E4Ofw.text: Great, a simple and authentic Italian restaurant. I had Pasta Alex and it was delicious. Also had the home made Tiramisu and it was amazing.  The only drawback is that they do not take Credit Cards, so I had to go out and get some cash (I never have cash) at a nearby ATM. It was worth it.

-RjX8RDEy5Vq5D0xOLKRmw.text: *************** I can still taste last nights meal **************          When it comes to Italian ........ it doesn't get any better then this.  Been coming here for the past seven years ...... all were 5 star experiences. We arrived on a Thursday at 6pm ........ 4 tables were occupied. By 6:30pm ....... 75% of the tables were occupied. By 7pm ...... it was a full house.         We were a group of four .....           We brought our own bottle of wine ....... YES ..... BYOB NO CORKAGE FEE.               Four entrees and a HUGE Antipasto Salad for four ...... $81 with tax.  Giuseppe and the wait staff ....... are a Riot ..... always "Mixing It Up" .... with the diners.  Bring Cash ...... No Credit cards or Debit cards or Euros accepted.

GV04bbQ1CvFSd9UkNLtGCQ.text: Awsome Italian.  Real authentic atmosphere.  Feels like you are really eating with Italians.  I had the special:  Baked Ziti and Cannelloni with 2 sauces.  So good.  Butter is unique and tasty with fresh baked bread.  Owner very friendly and concerned about you enjoying your meal.  Look forward to going back and trying the meatballs.  Restaurant is Cash Only but worth every penny.

fhaBApN1jHyG-Rbi5ygvCg.text: This is a genuine family, locals restaurant. Kid friendly. Small space and very nice staff.   Menu if traditional Italian favorites. I had the special which was basically Pescadoei and very good. Fresh homemade bread was excellent. Low marks for the anti pasta.   No liquor served but you can BYOB with no corkage fee, which it appeared most tables did. Cash only!

1teFyRK25TXPaX7jw_NNyQ.text: Such a disappointment. Ordered the Friday night special: crab cioppino. The crab is imitation. When I asked the waiter if it was fake crab, he did not know. The chef came out, reluctantly admitted it was intimation crab and proceeded to tell me real crab was too expensive. My friend ordered linguine and clams... The garlic was burnt and the pasta was sitting in some type of sauce which resembled oil. They never acknowledged that we did not eat our food and acted I as I offended them for calling out the imitation crab. Just advertise " imitation crab cioppino!"

Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fake Crab, no fish, chewy calamari.... Not cioppino

hwejPpQalqy7_gtr4X9iCg.text: Long wait for food mid week. I felt forgotten. Great pasta. I'm not going back.  The cash only sign must not be posted very big. We had to go to the ATM and got a service charge.  The rich get richer. Great for the owner

OhZTPq-WbJBjFfUT6JUR-w.text: Grazie Mille to Pasquale who accommodated our fairly large group (17) last night for a wonderful multi-course dinner.  The kitchen never skipped a beat on their timing for each course.  Clean dishes arrived magically along with the family style platters.  We were not pressed for time and chose a Monday night so we wouldn't disturb too many other guests.    Our meal lasted about 3 hours and every moment was perfectly orchestrated by Pasquale and his staff with entertaining stories and keeping us informed about what dishes we were eating.  He honored us by explaining in Italian and English since we were "graduating" from a basic Italian language class.  He even prepared special dishes for our folks with dietary restrictions!   The desserts are all made by "Mrs. Pasquale" so fresh and delicious.    We let Pasquale do all the ordering and he produced the whole meal for a prearranged fixed price.  (With a large group I like to do this, saves that stress at the end of the meal figuring out the bill) I think he went WAY overboard, it was such a wonderful dinner and so reasonable.  But the "regular" prices are great anyway, so don't let that stop you.  Go there NOW!   He has 17 new loyal customers so it might be busy.    It felt like a Sunday dinner at Nonna's, and we heartily thank and recommend Giuseppe's Ristorante to anyone.  Oh, did I mention that we brought our own wine?  They don't even charge a corking/glass fee!  Thank you again Pasquale, Alessandro, the invisible workers in the back, and all of the wonderful "studenti" who received their certificates  :)

laztuqrU4LUA7uv73-ZYWw.text: Called this restaurant first to see if they took reservations and they said no.  They are also a bring your own wine place but cash only restaurant.  We got there and there was only one table available in the place, it's very small.  They told us it would be a 10 min wait.  I asked about the empty table and he said some people came in but left to go get wine since they don't sell it there.  I reminded him that they don't take reservations which is basically what he was doing by holding the table for them and not seating us, customers who were there.   He said they would be right back, so we waited.  10 minutes went by and no one left the restaurant nor did the wine-runners come back.  So we hung out another 10 minutes and still the same thing.  We finally went back to him and said that he should just seat us since we have been waiting over 20 minutes now and the people he was holding the table for did not come back.  He refused to seat us!!  What poor management!  This is a dump of a place that says one thing and does another.  Avoid this place, there is much better Italian food in Scottsdale and an owners who know how to run their business.

JeT1IJc5wS5DGTd-tUpW4Q.text: Not happy, was promised fresh clam linguini ,lwas served with can clam linguini, very disappointed, mediocre flavor and textures

VVsDSQDL0KmwbOBkyNMOfA.text: First time here.. Found it on Yelp. Four of us all had different dishes and all were amazing. Definitely recommend it!

nXrvtZO0MPPwiqA99BcOSA.text: What a wonderful meal. Started with a bruschetta special with sauteed onions and tomatoes on garlic bread. The giant meatball was huge and delicious with a homemade marinera sauce. Finally my wife and I split the Alessandro lemon piccata chicken combined with the pasta Alex-perfect combo cheerfully recommended by our friendly waiter.  Now the negative. For some reason it is advertised on Yelp that there is no corkage fee which was confirmed when I called and ask during my reservation. Next the $15.95 price on the menu was changed to $19.95 without telling us.  Bottom line is good food but misleading menu prices and corkage.

LO6GqDFqTrW8MWyGjZRb8Q.text: Holy Rigatoni! Our family of four (including one picky eater) went last night for their NYE dinner. I was a tad skeptical, given that it was NYE and a fixed menu. All of us, including the aforementioned picky eater, loved everything. The food was excellent (my favorite, and my daughter's favorite was the eggplant rotellini, my wife's favorite was the Pasta Alex). And even though we were stuffed, we couldn't resist the wonderful desert.  And I cannot say enough about the warm, wonderful service. I mentioned the picky eater - they made him special mini dishes...and...get this...he tried the eggplant. You don't know us or him, so you don't know how epic that statement is - he actually tried and liked eggplant.   Thank you everyone for a wonderful NYE dinner! We will be back often for occasions big and small!

7XHuL-8uc7jHLeXaSngaew.text: Family is the source for fantastic food - this is why Ristorante Giuseppe's is an amazing spot for neighborhood Italian.  First introduced over a decade ago, my family has returned and now makes Giuseppe's a staple for take out or a relaxed evening out.  Very busy on the weekends starting at 6, so show up early.  Love the Eggplant Rollatini, Pasta Alex, and the Alfredo sauce is perfect on anything.    The adult sons pitch in on weekends, and certainly make mom and pop proud.  I love supporting this place, and hope my kids can keep coming back year after year.

v1Vhhfx6a7g54YwSI-CYVw.text: Just restored my faith in humanity via amazing pasta and better service. The pasta in Rome can't compete!   One might be tempted to overlook this place but you'd be a fool. If you love Italian food and your in Scottsdale then make sure you come here. Alex is the bomb and he will take great care of you. And that's no bs.  I will be back!

jPj7s0gZanKVCBf1Lgw4_w.text: Amazing homemade food! Highly recommend to go to this place! We can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu! Cash only.

kHasqy9Lw65yhRtTHU1ziw.text: Being from europe i guarantee you will get the best Italian experience ever. Food is only a part of a restaurant , the characters and personality is equally important yet too often absent. Giuseppe has it all. We have been there for 10 years and never disapponted!

SAwfz5hxwv3_pcSuL97Qyw.text: A great family run place, that tastes like a genuine Italian ristorante. I say: "Ciao bella"!  We arrived last night looking forward to a well prepared Italian meal. Our expectations were peaked by all our Yelp friends, raving about the personal service and delicious old style Italian food. We weren't disappointed.  The owner, Pasquale greeted us as we came in, and sat us in the back.  It would provide a good place to observe his personal touch with all the customers.  Our server Cody came by almost immediately to ask if we had brought any wine, and if he could open it and bring us glasses.  As others have noted, Ristorante Giuseppe is a Bring Your Own (BYOB) place.  Our oldest was celebrating her Birthday Day, so we were in a festive mood.  I've taken some photos of the interior of the restaurant. Clearly they were working on that Italian Grotta feel.  It has some buca di beppo type wall decorations.  But unlike that chain, here it's decorated by actual family photos and vacations shots. Very genuine!  Just like Pasquale.  We started out with the bruschetta.  It came with four pieces of italian bread for $10.95.  It might have seemed pricey, though the tomatoes were sweet and had a interesting topping of several cheeses. Delicious.  We next shared the Antipasto.  It was a very full plate of greens, meats and cheeses for $8.95.  The dressing was a light oil and vinegar that was just right.  For our entree, we each tried something different.  I went for the capellini with their homemade Neopolitan sauce.  Cody talked me into one of their meatballs, which was good.  But, not as good as their pasta and red sauce.  Sometimes with a marinara, if it's left to cook too long it can get bitter.  Not here, it was naturally sweet with chucks of tomato.  My wife ordered her favorite dish of Chicken Parmigiana, that came with spaghetti for $14.95. It wasn't a pounded piece of chicken cutlet, but instead an entire breast. Very nice!  Our daughter ordered the spicy Pasta Alex  for $15.95.  The menu describes it as the Chef's creation -- of pasta in a cardinale/pesto sauce with roasted garlic and spicy, crumbled, Italian sausage.  It was outstanding!  The heat came from the crusted red peppers and was just right.  The sauce actually reminded me more of a vodka cream reduction.  It was sweet and full of flavor.  Clearly the best of all the dishes!  For dessert, we tried the flour-less Chocolate cake, the Tiramisu and a Cannoli for $4.95 each.  I've taken a picture of the Tiramisu, because it came as an individual piece of two moist lady fingers. Wow!    If you're out and it's late, I would highly recommend coming here just for dessert and espresso.  It would be well worth it.  Our bill came to $88 in change including taxes but before gratuities. It was hand written and not itemized.  Another one of those personal touches which some might find quirky.  After getting home, I exchanged a bunch of messages with Yelp'er Michael T on how delicious the sauces were at Giuseppe's.  It's that unbridled enthusiasm and passion that folks have for this restaurant and it's owner Pasquale that make it special.   If you are looking for a white table cloth, foo foo experience; you might be disappointed and not understand the beauty of Ristorante Giuseppe.  But, we weren't, and we'll be back real soon.  Enjoy!

HY3kofr3FzQAEfWxYjHBQg.text: Small, quaint and very friendly. Gnocchi Bolognese was fabulous and reminded me of my time I lived in Italy.  I wish I lived a little closer, will be back with family. Grazie!

4T6-OHVhQhfjRcvHGk1TNg.text: Went here a couple years ago and the food was excellent and not expensive. So this most recent trip I stayed nearby and went here for dinner with 3 other guys from work. I ordered something I saw in a picture on Yelp, but wasn't sure what it was called. The waiter said they didn't have it so I told him I just wanted tortellini instead. We ordered an appetizer of garlic bread that came with 4 pieces so we split the bill on that one. We all each ordered a drink.  Garlic bread was nothing but a 4" x 4" piece of toasted bread. Bland and boring. No big deal.  Then the food came. I received this small plate of tortellini. Not very much food at all. In fact was such a small amount I ordered the cheesecake so I would be full. The cheesecake was good by the way.   Then the bill comes. $30.95!!!! Hand written, total only, not itemized so no idea what they are charging.   I got back to my hotel room and look at the menu. Tortellini - 7.95 Garlic bread - 2.95 divided by = 0.75 ea Drink - 1.95 Cheese cake - 3.95 Total = 14.60 Now I understand the prices may be outdated, but I highly doubt the prices have more than doubled in the past year since the picture was taken.  My coworkers were all confused as well at the prices. I think we were all charged double! I don't live in Arizona so I most likely won't be back, but even if I did I still don't think I'd be back. $30.95 for a small plate of tortellini. Kinda bummed. Thought this was going to be my go to place for Italian. I guess not.  Then it came time to pay and they don't accept cards. Well I didn't have enough cash on me so I had to borrow money. I probably would've left a tip, but I borrowed all my coworker had left on him just to pay the regular bill. Not to worry since they charged us double. Probably pocketed the $16 I overpaid.

BdCwWOuzWFduE9-cBWKIvA.text: We have eaten here a few times over the years and not been real impressed.  The restaurant is unattractive with tables jammed in a small space.   The "cash only" signs don't add to the ambiance.  The worn tables are covered with pieces of glass displaying numerous pictures of previous guests (?).  You are given a cheap paper napkin and "disposable utensils.  The menu prices do not match the prices posted on their website.  In fact, many of the dishes are double or more.  On the restaurant menu, there are a whole range of dishes without prices.  When the server was asked, he sort of stumbled.  My husband and I had the same dishes on our last two visits which were two months apart. The prices quoted were different.  Seems like nobody knows what they are.  The prices are outrageous for what you get and the lousy, noisy ambiance.  Food is OK - nothing special, rather bland.  The bread is awful and not very fresh.  Service is fair and the owner is rather unfriendly, unless you are a regular, which is someone I don't want to be.  A couple of the servers wear rather offensive t-shirts.  The bill is on a receipt from the 50's, with just a total amount due - no price breakdown.  To me it is the NO restaurant - NO reservations, NO credit cards and NO alcohol.  With these, along with the ridiculous prices, the owner is laughing all the way to the bank.  All in all, a place I would not recommend nor plan on returning to.

zBc0Yeni7QzRVLJh3LZ_Og.text: This is definitely a local hang out. All the customers knew to bring a bottle wine as they don't have a liquor license. We ordered few of their pasta dishes along with soup of day and eggplant appetizer. The eggplant was the best I ever had. Their pastas were good too. However, I couldn't give a 5 star because they use frozen vegetables...noticed the spongy baby carrots, and the pasta was little overlooked. Not many places can make the pastas al dente. Also, this restaurant had strange locker room smell to it; probably due to poor ventilation.

qim7iaF1-b36M1XI6jZhqg.text: So as I True Italian I know real, good, Italian food. This place hasn't let me down. The wifey hyped up this place, so I had to try it out on my own. Great little place! Excited to try something else next time.  Ciao!  -Antonio

zkMSnuQ6S07ULmdT-ScGCA.text: We love Italian food, so we try lots of places. This is one of our new favorite places. We had antipasto salad, eggplant rollotini, chicken parmigiana and canolis. All of it was great. We picked up the food and didn't eat there. They were so nice! We wanted zucchini parmigiana,  but he told me that they were out of zucchini.  He said if I bought zucchini to them that they would make it. That was amazing! Nice people.  Great food. The canolis were heavenly. Try this place. You won't be disappointed.

IRXT0ykuqZuuqV_CldLz7A.text: no credit cards. cash only. that's definitely not a good business decision.  went with friends, won't return. food was less than warm, bland & overpriced for what was served. service was wayyyyyy too slooooow. babbo's is much better!!!

ENeMHgjQj4aOxN0g5c0UKQ.text: Wow, can't believe the ratings on this place...Olive Garden is better...disappointment!

6L3JqMfeJZJsWNRU-iI0Hw.text: Fantastic Italian food. You wont be disappointed. Grab a nice bottle of wine to bring with you and Enjoy!! Love this restaurant! Cash only

-IVE7ab4PInAJF7AK1sR7A.text: Love their food! We love coming here for traditional family owned Italian food. Only reason. It not 5 star because they only accept cash.

CnNBkjxEEVjWXOceQ0zkTg.text: A True taste of Italy! Can't think of a nicer family than the one who runs this restaurant. We are always greeted with smiles and genuine, good conversation... A truly fun & relaxing atmosphere. Bring your own alcohol (no charge), and they'll open it for you and bring you more when you need it. Now, for the food, everything is good so you really can't go wrong. The bruschetta is a great starter. The Pasta Alex is a favorite of ours, spicy with a hint of garlic. And to finish it off I recommend the tiramisu, light and delicious. Overall, this restaurant is a family favorite... we return as often as we can.

2MSeNNy_bkYPDqqEJFVilQ.text: Great dinner tonight.  Pasquale is a gracious host.  The highlight of course was the Pasta Alex, don't come here without trying it.

_-dQfj754qQnoXDq2nMPWg.text: Love this guy and this Italian joint.  Reminds me of Frank singing My Way. The owner does it his way.  You like it. Great. You don't that's ok too.  Reminds me of cafes in North Beach San Fran in the 70s or a little like Naples. Good sauces with attitude.  Leave your attitude at home and mangia. Oh, and bring cash. They don't no plastic...that's for suckers

W87fcVdxhz67JF6Ki_Yz9Q.text: It was good.  The atmosphere is nothing to write home about, the pasta was good, the meatball was very good.  It is not overpriced, and it is not a great deal.  Service was good.  If you want to have a simple, relaxing, pretty good Italian meal at a fair price, and atmosphere is not all that important  to you then give this place a try.

XDydHdWynCMyk_ZqPQFIjA.text: Wonderful food, great service and the best hospitality in town. We found this restaurant through Yelp and it turned out to be a gem. Great family owned business with wonderful homemade recipes. Would recommend!!!

dEdCXJyZ6_g_i_99OL4j_g.text: I just got back from Giuseppe's and I am absolutely amazed that people gave it the reviews they did. We went there in large part because of the Yelp reviews and learned that I need to take the reviews with a grain of salt (if I could find any salt left, since it all seemed to go into my meal). However, I did observe the owner and one of the servers greeting gastronomically-challenged regulars with hugs and kisses as the tacky Italian tourist music (some ditty with a chorus that went something like "iggedy biggedy boom") blared in the background.  Perhaps those unfamiliar with the wonderful restaurants Scottsdale has to offer were overwhelmed by the aforementioned music, the plastic red and white checkered table "cloths", the largely-abandoned strip mall, the rumble from motorcycles on Scottsdale Road (it is Cycle Week this week - yahoo!) or the roar of planes landing a few hundred yards away at Scottsdale Airport.  The menu itself is significantly less than uninspiring - something you'd expect at a Papa Gino's (though the food may be better there) versus an "authentic" Italian restaurant. My wife had a seafood "special" that smelled and tasted like it came out of a can. Perhaps it did, but if it didn't, shame on Giuseppe for turning fresh ingredients into a stomach-turning mess. Her meal was very bland, so I suppose the canned flavor gave it some distinction.  I had a chicken and pasta dish with their self-acclaimed tomato and fresco sauce. The vegetables were mushy, but that was the least of its problems.  There were a few positive points to this place that we will never go back to. The server and the owner were both very nice, so I suppose their not throwing the foot at us or uttering obscenities was worth one star. And the garlic bread and chive butter for the regular bread were pretty good, so if you want to pay $40 to just be able to talk about the bread, go knock yourself out.  Lastly, they only accept cash. I guess they do that so that you can't dispute the charge with the credit card company. Best I can tell, that's the one smart move they've made at Giuseppe's.

kg1f6FMRGM9Kpyve3amoIw.text: I've enjoyed my trip to  Phoenix and the good food is one of the reasons.  I really liked Ristorante Giuseppe.  Great food and the owner was very welcoming.  Plus BYOB.  Yes, not the fanciest place, but felt like you were dining someplace special.  I would go back in a heartbeat.

7pzUsG7Xou9jIdsJHCRb0g.text: I was a little apprehensive when I first walked in because there were only a few people and some very loud cooks. They seemed to know I had not been there before but things got better. Good caprese salad-excellent lasagna. Definitely tastes like home. Place was packed by the time I left. Will come back with friends and a bottle of wine. Glad I finally made it there!

lKMHwlThtY_uHoWHRlUd2g.text: YUM!  Good people, good food, good prices.  Like eating with family! (if only I spoke another language!!!) Oh, it's BYO, and they only take cash.  Be prepared, and you're gonna luv it!

vizkOPxrjwr9yzTubqClJg.text: I want to go back...but it's too far away!  This place is a little gem in Scottsdale and I recommend it if you want a good meal, served in a family run, casual environment.  Our waiter was one of the family, and the pride and care he showed should make his parents proud.  He waited on us (all 13 of us!) like he was our friend.  As a lot of the reviews mention, it's BYOB and they do not accept credit cards, so it's a little out of the norm by today's dining out standards.  But don't let this dissuade.  We started out with Chicken Bruschetta...and wow is all I can muster.  I had Eggplant Rollatini for dinner, and my mouth is watering just thinking about it now.  It was the perfect balance of Eggplant, spinach, cheese and sauce.  We were celebrating two birthday's which were celebrated with Canolli's and a little tiramisu.  If you are in the area...go to Ristorante Giuseppe!

nvWnOhWeLYNMNGVNkwEKFg.text: I have since gone back to Giuseppe's and am still as satisfied with it as before. Great authentic dishes and the best in-house cheesecake I have tasted. I never pass up dessert when I am here.

3dIbAlvBPOvfoEkrTObvUg.text: byob only, cash only, amazing meatballs and delicious seafood pasta on Fridays. outdoor seating, 3rd generation family owned and operated. (Napoli) hands down the best cannoli I have ever had--lovingly made by the family matriarch.

G_Kx5CAs6PKQFuWWubBx6Q.text: Great friendly staff, wonderful food!  Gets busy quickly.  LOVED the Ravioli's with Meat Sauce!  Will definitely make this place a regular on my stops to Scottsdale! Generous portions so no one could try the desserts but I hear they are fabulous too!  CASH ONLY so don't forget to bring some of the green stuff!

LaURu-wIVZqLC4A2jzG6JQ.text: We live literally down the street from this hidden gem.  Came across it by accident and decided to try it out for dinner. Sat outside.  I ordered spaghetti with sausage. The portion was a little smaller than I was hoping for but it was made up in flavor.  Wow. If you are after flavorful Italian food look no further. My wife is still talking about the meatball she ordered.  The service was great and I felt appreciated for being there.  Cash only was sort of a pain but again the food quality was outstanding.  Highly recommend this place.

j1NIiClu-ctfO3dQYO4v2Q.text: Pretty sure we met the whole family last time we were in. Never been to Italy but when I do, I expect the food will equate. The food is fantastic but a bit steep for pasta and tomato sauce.   Notables:  Cash Only Great place if you don't mind an arrogant waiter every once in a while They don't serve alcohol but I hear they charge $0 to uncork.

UXKsK5LQjyYakcR9IlXzSg.text: Family style, friendly, mom&pop, yummy italian restaurant! 5/5  This restaurant is definitely one of our fav in town! We are lucky to find it about a year ago. Giuseppe is a family-owned italian restaurant on N. Scottsdale Rd with super friendly services. My favorate dishes there are on their 'chef recommended' menu. The price is higher than the rest of the entrees on the menu but not super expensive. One 'chef-recommended' entree is about $15. Very affortable and you won't dissapointed with the food. My all time fav dish there is a tomato based seafood pasta (only available over the weekends). This restaurant is a BYOW place~ Deserts is amazing too... Yumm...

FtakrDA1uXMNyTqNdGz8dw.text: I've been looking for a good BYOB place since moving here.  This place is pretty great.  The place feeled really authentic.  We didn't have to wait for a table.  I had the Alexandro and my date had spaghetti and meatballs.  Both were pretty good.  The cash only thing sucks but bringing your own wine really makes up for it.  I will definetly come here again!

ZQS6EWGuI8S-UQsY5GNcVg.text: Always amazing, great food friendly atmosphere! Feels like your at a good friends houses for dinner. Cash only and no alcohol but no cork charge if you bring your own bottle.

atp55CbtcmQKYp6dsDYnjQ.text: 4.5 Stars.  I had the linguini with clam.  The pasta was a bit soft as I prefer al dente but it was still tasty and the sauce was delicious.  My friend thought his meal was good but not excellent.  I would go back for sure.

P65s1TpZrlp7a8IuW2ndrA.text: Excellent place. Can't beat BYOB with no corkage fee and fresh Italian food. Definitely recommend!!

OkJHw44QIKCqFK1O16bHIg.text: Food was authentic and yummy. It was very inexpensive and you can bring your own wine!! What a concept. No cork fees either.

Ax1VdPDXy7I78dIbJjeHng.text: Went back and needless to say, I am impressed! It was all delicious! Love the pasta Alex!

urlWU6HZgV4fl0bv4en1zw.text: Great food and service with a friendly attitude.  I have been eating here for many years.  The food is consistently good and prices reasonable.  Yes, they only accept cash.  Also, they don't serve alcohol, but you can bring your own.  Lunch, dinner or take-out:  you can't go wrong with Giuseppe's.

BudJYQ9pF-k_gfNaaf3ZOg.text: My Husband and I took my Grandma to Ristorante Giuseppe this evening.  Since it was a weeknight after a storm there was practically no one there, which was fine by me since I already knew this place could get crowded (based on other yelp reviews).  My Husband and I shared the one of the pasta specials, which was baked ziti with all sorts of meats.  It was creamy, cheesy, meat filled goodness.  We also had a salad and garlic bread, which was also unique since it had a kick.  My Grandma had the pork parmigiana, she loved it.  Overall, this is a small Mom and Pop shop and it was VERY good.  It's always nice to support great places like Ristorante Giuseppe that are family owned and have great authentic food!

Oq24HMV1KkdoJO1Jg62UNg.text: Holy cow, thank you Gabi and Jared for bringing me here for dinner last night! I cannot believe I lived in North Scottsdale for a year and didn't know about this place....I'm so sad!   When I walked in I felt instantly at home, this place could easily be in my hometown.  Everyone was so friendly and seemed to know each other.  We were able to choose our table and got comfortable.  (Its very small and I'd imagine gets busy at times)    It is indeed BYOB with no corking fee.  The menu is simple but has all the staples an Italian restaurant should have at the prices these dishes should be priced at.  The garlic bread was good, the baked ziti was divine.  It reminded me exactly of the baked ziti I used to get at the local place in my hometown and was prepared just how I like it....very light on the ricotta, heavy on the mozzarella.  The cannoli I had for dessert was fantastic.   Giuseppe's is exactly what you are looking for when you want the kind of Italian meal you had growing up on the East Coast.

EHWN_Uf5asVcfybYEMlCig.text: My coworkers and I tried this place out on a whim one night when we wanted some good Italian cooking, and we successfully satisfied our cravings with Giuseppe's - we totally loved it! Ok, ok, 99% of that could be due to the FREE CORKAGE that they offer (and I'm a sucker for free corkage), but it's also an adorably quintessential, family-owned Italian place that isn't fussy but serves great food.  We walked into the restaurant (located in a little strip mall - like I said, not fussy) and were seated immediately by a window. It wasn't until we asked for a wine menu and were informed that it was BYOB that we figured out the whole free corkage thing...never one to turn down such an offer, I promptly solicited the help of my PDA to see if I could find somewhere nearby that would sell us a bottle, and thankfully Epicurean Wine & Cafe came to our rescue! They recently opened around the corner on Thunderbird and were more than willing to recommend a good wine for our Italian food, so I gotta give them props - make a stop by here before going to Giuseppe's as they have some unusual California wines that I've rarely seen outside SoCal.  Anyway, for dinner I ordered their tortellini special, which was some chicken pesto with cheese, etc. deliciousness...after I finished I was almost embarrassed at how quickly I ate the entire dish of pasta, but it was just so yummy! It was a dish that just oozed the love that was put into making it. One of my coworkers also ordered the spaghetti, which she said was great as well. Be forewarned, though - they don't accept credit cards, so you might need to stop by an ATM beforehand.  Somehow I have the feeling that anything we could have ordered would have been great...and cheap! I definitely want to come back for another taste!

hgr31YhGMBRjyy-yRzqHxA.text: Only two surprises about this place.  The price was less than we thought and the food was as good as any cafe in Milan.  John

fT9_wg25CEOck-5iyd8Xqw.text: I've been hearing about Giuseppes for months now, and finally decided to try it out.  Needless to say, its a gem of a restaurant tucked away in a boring looking strip center.  The staff is very friendly, and they do their best to make sure you're well taken care of.  The food is very good - they do very simple things, but they do them very well.  The BYOB is a nice touch, and its great that they appreciate wine as an integral part of the meal - they dont want to penalize you for bringing your own supply.  Its always nice to find a local place like this that is family owned - you can sense the pride in all the workers attitudes.  I'll definitely be back. Its cash only, but there's a BBVA right across the parking lot - easy little walk if you need some extra dough.

9v0Y6qs8c-kb0on4x5Sb-Q.text: I grew up eating Pasquale's food along with, when I had saved room, his wife's incredible desserts. The charm of the owner and the conviviality that is found in his restaurant always made it a real treat to eat there. Most of these happy memories occurred while he was at the location on 28th St. and Indian School... Which is no longer under his control. This location is where the talent that originated 'Giuseppe's on 28th' ended up.   The food here is absolutely delicious. Not a fancy, pretentious place, just consistently great food. BYOB with no fancy interior, this place defies so many Scottsdale norms it should seemingly fail. It's usually got a good many people in it, because I'm not the only one that knows, I'm just sharing the knowledge with all my Yelpin' peeps :]  I'm yelping this here restaurant because I feel I have to right a wrong. You see, the Giuseppe's on 28th [why did they let them keep the name? I'll never know] was featured the Food TV show "Diners, Drive-ins and Dives." Cashing in on the reputation built by Pasquale, these guys overcharge for crappy renditions of the dishes I grew up loving.   If you really want to see the difference, try the eggplant parmesan sandwich at both locations. Really there can be no comparison. Or the rich, artery-clogging Alfredo sauce... Oh god just writing about it is making me realize I need to go back soon.  So, I put it to you, my fellow yelpers... Can you give this place a try and tell me if I'm right? I admit there's a chance I could be over-romanticizing due to my childhood experiences... But everyone I've brought here has been equally enamored with the food and with Pasquale.

CpDnlscrqqwDrH4jGrWAhQ.text: Super small place and make sure to bring cash. The food was decent and I wasn't too impressed. The meatballs were grainy and filled with too much bread. The owner sat at the table next to me. He thought that shouting expletives with his friends and drinking a little too much vino was a good idea. I definitely won't be back. In the end if you want to drop $80 for 4 people and mediocre Italian food then you've found the right place.

hBT2RTGmglVa-GpbvDXmlA.text: Everything we wanted and more in an intimate Italian restaurant.  The service was prompt as we entered and were immediately seated.  My first surprise was that they did not serve wine - BYOW.  My wife ordered the special Cannoli served under a white cream sauce.  I chose a custom agli olio dish with a little extra zip.    Our salad course was delicious.  The lettuce actually crunched as we ate it - by far the freshest we have had in any Italian restaurant.  Our pasta dishes were just as fresh and delicious.  We spent quite a bit of time with the owner Giuseppe talking about our upcoming trip to Italy and he proved to be a wealth of knowledge and advice.  Before leaving, he treated us to a very special traditional after dinner Limoncello - a perfect ending to a perfect meal.

dXQnxYK-s5Ikf-ZO0dShWg.text: Staff: Great Atmosphere: Great Food:  GRAND BYOW (free?!):  Nuff said.  The special bean salad was amazing, the zucchini parmigiana was almost pure bliss, and my husband's spaghetti had two meatballs nearly the size of his fist.  Good thing this place isn't closer.  We'd be broke.  :)

rYLg1TafjQa94tarqKgJTg.text: After walking around the Desert Botanical Garden this past Saturday night we were starving and my mom had this place in mind for dinner. With a bottle of Campaign in a cooler pack (love BYOB) we pulled up at 9:00 pm to find a closed sign at the door. We asked if we could still come in for dinner and they took us in. I do find 9pm a little early to be closing on a Saturday, but I didn't care. I had a table, a drink, and it smelled good.  Hot bread was brought over with garlic & herb butter. Great start to the meal. I ordered the chicken parmesan and they gave me a side of the Alex Pasta. It was all de-lish! The portions are generous and while the dessert menu looked good, we were stuffed. Guess I need to save room next time. FYI- cash only!

HNFeJ2fzh85DBVMul4nTmg.text: **BYOB**  Ristorante Giuseppe is a tiny little restaurant that's only open for a few hours - and if you're lucky enough to beat the rush and get a table you will never forget it.    The staff really treats you like family, without all the bickering... The food is FABULOUS and the specials are special for a reason.  The price isn't really bad for the quality of food you're getting.   Oh, did I mention their desserts?  OMG - don't leave this place without ordering at least two items from the dessert menu.

368FgMMiviKwVssg40o9vQ.text: This was probably my favorite italian experience so far. Before we even got in the down the owner came out to where we were waiting for more friends to get a count and invite us in. Our table was ready when we got there and his personality and personal touch was really greatly appreciated in a world of drab in phoenix. The place was crowed and there wasn't a single table empty. The whole place has a very family feel to it. The tables and walls are covered in family pictures and vacations to italy. (wish i was in their family)  The menu is kinda funny because all it has on it are the names of the dishes, it doesn't waste anytime trying to tell you what those dishes are lol.  It's BYOB and there's no corking fee, the waiter seemed kinda of bewildered when we knew previous to showing up about that but still didn't bring anything with us. He was very helpful and animated.  We got all of a drinks and food in good time. I ordered one of the specials, "pasta alex" which was a pesto and tomato sauce with some ground sausage pasta dish. Man was it good, and I mean really good. We all walked away raving about how good the food was. Everyone was super happy and half of us got their specialty dishes.   My friend and i shared one of their canolis and it was really awesome as well.   I don't have anything bad to say about this place, i'll pay the price of kickass italian food any day.    They only take cash! and they don't even give you an itemized bill, lol it just came on the back of our order that was given to the cook, and it just said $135. LOL but I really don't care, I'll pay it!

uotBz2IUIl_gA3IW_oQ31A.text: SO GOOD!  I love this place!  They have fantastic pasta and sauces!  Both the tomato and alfredo are amazing.   My favorite item on the menu is their stuffed peppers and it comes with a side of pasta, so it's the perfect lunch.  I go here about 3 times a month for lunch... and have for the last year!  The family that owns the restaurant is super nice too... and they have a cute waiter that my friends like to look at when we go here.  Gotta love Italian men!

vrvL5X0ReYl-e60N82XYFA.text: Great food, great service and overall great experience. I am 100% Italian and am very picky about eating out Italian food and they know good Italian food.  They are great!

QXXOChEh_WApWZAyZmBZAA.text: Finally...good Italian food in Phoenix! And, I'm a little hesitant to write about how great this place is as it is already super busy, but it is awesome!   It is super small , which can result in quite a wait, especially on the weekends, but well worth it! (They are also awesome for takeout as well). It is also currently BYOB with no corkage fee!   From the minute you meet Pasquale and the rest of the guys there, you know you have found something great! Definitely go with their recommendations as I have loved them all and I have also really enjoyed the Red Clam sauce, which is next to impossible to find here in AZ that is worth eating! The cannoli's...amazing!   Also, they are accommodating for people with gluten allergies. They will either adjust one of their meat/pork entrees to work for you or you can ask about bringing in your own, unopened bag of GF pasta. I do have to caution you that when it is super busy, they aren't always able to accommodate when you bring your own pasta, so just be sure you are good with the back up plan!   Can't wait to go again, but don't foget to bring cash as they don't take credit/debit cards and they do close at 8:30pm!!

yr1NCG0akAqmMC6BNfOq_w.text: Guiseppe's was recommended to us last night so we deceided to try it tonight with our two young grandaughters.   What a find, the food was great.  The place is small and  unpretentious. I started with the pasta figiolli, it was different then I'm used to , a little creamier then most, but very tasty.  We ordered a eggplant Parm, a pasta Alex, and a spegetti & Meatballs for the kids.  Everything was great.  The service was attentive and made sure we had what we needed.  We brought our own wine and the billl came to under $60.    We'll defintley be back............

05bSMKSseU3vY_bioVrjdg.text: Always a good bet!  I first ate there in 1994 and have been there many times since. Great Italian food, great service, fresh ingredients. Good prices. It's a hole in the wall, so don't expect fancy, cash only too.

-E72Wc7XLldA-wAtwm3xQw.text: This is a great little family run Italian restaurant in a strip mall.  Don't let the location or decor steer you away, the food is really quite good.  While the place is rather small and usually pretty crowded, we have never had to wait too long.    There is no alcohol available but you can BYOB and they don't charge a corkage fee.  Make sure to bring cash as it's the only way you can pay.  The prices are fairly reasonable however and portions are certainly adequate but usually not obnoxious.    The owner has always been very personable on our visits and you'll likely be waited on by one of his sons.  Even though we are from out of town we always feel as if they remember us.    My son LOVES their meatballs (they are huge).  The eggplant is good too and try the Tiramisu; I believe the owner's wife makes many of the desserts.  As for pasta dishes, we usually just tell the waiter what we are in the mood for and they recommend something.  We've never been disappointed.

s_AEgwAHzBnxstynl72LKg.text: I whole-heartedly agree with Shannon W. on this one! Very yummy, hearty homemade Italian fare. And very reasonable prices! That's a big one for me, with a large family and a school-teacher hubby :)  Anyway, Giuseppe's is perfect for family gatherings or everyday go-to restaurant. Try the eggplant parmigiana and pasta w/tomato-cream sauce, and definitely save room for dessert!   Oh -- and Shannon -- it IS BYOB and there is NO corkage fee.

h7sali2iIrTRVBSJ1tLx0A.text: We were greeted at the door with some friendly heckling by the manager as we entered and the good natured ribbing continued throughout the meal.  The food was simple and delicious, warm bread with garlic butter, meat ravioli with red sauce and some lovely veal parm.  I was a fan of the portion sizes since I'll eat what is in front of me despite fullness at times.  The smell of the kitchen was a wonderful compliment to the meal and the wait staff was gracious and cheerful.   For the sizes of the meals it felt a little expensive, but everything tasted freshly made with vibrant flavors so I forgave the price a little.

rSONwYTRRCp-4BlyhlbMVQ.text: Tremendous and about as authentic as you'll find in Phoenix.  Inexpensive and no frills but great food. You'll always have to wait about 30 mins and it's BYOB so make sure you bring a nice bottle of vino.

-NPMbraxg90xuWCNYsNkGw.text: We were introduced to this place by some friends and loved it. Very authentic Italian feel. The vibe is exactly what we would experience in a Italian restaurant back home in New York. Be prepared to pay cash and don't expect to get any fancy garnishing or oversized plates without very much food. Good sized portions, great authentic tastes, and an old town Italian feel. I Highly recommending this place for lunch or dinner.

pS2cr7smEZV5u7z-44_Pxw.text: I had the cioppino and it was excellent.  The garlic bread cooking in the pizza ovens had wondrous smell that really sets the appetite in motion.  Staff was very attentive and we had a great meal.

BkvaMCXPgSd5AdydAEovDg.text: Terrible experience at this establishment. The waiter we had was a complete dick. The owner was also mean and unwelcoming. Food wasn't that great.

04UdO4dF7VLHIQqnVqDtUQ.text: I was really hoping this place was going to be great based off of the reviews. It was mediocre at best with terrible service, they forgot to bring out items we ordered. Coming from New Jersey we expected great Italian and it was bland and nothing exciting. Tried the meatball and chicken parm, not the best and not the worst. It was really warm in the restaurant and almost uncomfortable and if the waiter ever came back around we would have let him know.   If you are looking for average food, bad service, and a place that only takes cash, this place is for you. On to the next place to find that great Italian food.

8Pc4awy2cdYpgwHYoYkNUA.text: Loved the food last night.  We made reservation (group of 10) at 5pm and we were there until almost the resturant closed.  My favorite was tomorrow's special, asiago beef ravioli, home made.  They just finished making them for the next day, and shortly after I ordered regular beef lavioli, they came to me to offer thie asiago beef.  I must say this was the best ravioli I've ever had.  If I had more bread, I would be scouping up all the sauce that was left on the plate.  We ordered four other pasta, two salad, and some appertizer. Everything we ordered was very good.  Why not five star? It's probably because of pasta. I would prefer a slightly more on al dente side.  They have a good selection on desert too. Home made tiramisu was very moist.  They have several different today's special. If you like something, call ahead a few days in advance and request.  I would definately request my ravioli before my next visit here.  Cioppino is highly recommended too

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Home made tiramisu, really good
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Asiago need ravioli. Tomorrow&#39;s special but since they finished making they served today. The best ravioli I ever had
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cioppino

yOK6tryfoC-tPJNuGWom_A.text: This location was located at the south end of a retail strip. There is another Italian place at the northwest section of this corner, but don't make the mistake.  Pasquale (I think?) Was friendly and welcoming. The eggplant appetizer was fantastic, served bruschetta-style with warm tomatoes on top. The garlic - cheese bread was a perfect balance of soft and crusty.  I had the manicotti. The ricotta was flowing from the noodles and was PERFECT.  The sauce was amazing...not too salty, not too sweet.  It tasted amazingly fresh.  My co-worker has an Alfredo chicken parmesan, with perfectly cooked fetuccine.  The sauce wasn't too heavy, and paired with that perfect chicken was....well, perfect!   I have already recommended this place to several dolks, and will be back!

mCnStK_WKUBz5ygjRW5vEg.text: Amazing Italian food and the owners and waiters were amazing and hilarious. Will definitely go back. Such quality food and it's so delicious

zI3ESLPfF8OSe0HfQ2duSA.text: My fiance has been talking about this place for a while and I finally had to go in and try it since we were looking for someone to cater an event for us. I am from NY and from the first bite it reminded me of home and authentic Italian cooking I am used to. The sauce was amazing. The bruschetta some of the best I've had. Needless to say we booked them to cater for us and what an easy process that was. The owner was knowledgeable and made great suggestions for what we may want to do off the menu. Overall I think this may be one of the best experiences I have had at a restaurant since moving out here.

P1vyIaLtBo_m6kUPBQPSdg.text: Came for dinner and was very impressed. The food was excellent, the prices are fair, the service was good and portions were large.   I saw somebody had posted a picture of a little combo plate on Yelp. It wasn't on the menu but I showed the server the picture and he said he could make it happen. So I had the combo with manicotti and baked ziti with a meatball. Their sauce was excellent and the meatball was one of the best I've ever had.  We also started with small dinner salads....nothing special but fresh and good.  They don't take credit cards....so make sure you have cash ready.   It's a family place and everybody leaves with a handshake and pat on the back from the owner. It's a great atmosphere.   I would definitely come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken parm
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Side meatballs
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gnocchi with cardinale sauce

4uLcadiAU4lMaCm06gtJSQ.text: Very nice family and date night restaurant. The food is very good. Bring your favorite wine - love that. The eggplant was excellent. Ziti was pretty good. Was a little bland IMHO, but I'm not Italian so they probably know best! I'd definitely go again. It gets very busy after 6.

imaE2556z7ls1H6gvQBVSw.text: Like usual, absolutely delicious. When I got there I was greeted right outside the front door, he had my takeout ready and everything was packaged perfectly.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Parmigiana

hLhINuXlyPoQsgYzyLYODg.text: Although there was quite the crowd here when we had dinner on 03/3017, the food was unremarkable or just plain poor.  I ordered Ravioli with meat.  It seemed straight out of the freezer and prepared. Taste was subpar.  She ordered soup.  Very poor.  She hardly ate it. This is a CASH ONLY restaurant.  Why?   Also, BYOB. No alcoholic beverages.   Makes me think of IRS and/or licensing problems.    There are so many other great restaurants.  Take a pass on this one and go somewhere else.

ffE99CGfTcQ37oUAII4fEA.text: My favorite Italian restaurant. Pascale and his family treat us as if we are members of their family.  The service is personal. The food is outstanding. and it's  Ms Pascuale who puts literally puts the icing on the cakes with here spectacular desserts

HxLylwq5TKj8Y_b38IqhEw.text: Special surprise to find this place in a non-descript and otherwise barren strip mall.  We were driving around looking for anywhere to eat and as soon as we opened the door and heard all the laughing and saw the corny Italian soccer memorabilia we knew we found a gem.  Amazing handmade sauces unlike anything that you have ever had elsewhere.  Kids loved the food, big portions and just wish that I could have gone a second time before I had to go back home.

Xs9VWiRzy0d6t5OPQZgfxw.text: FIRST THING:  BYOB!  Pick out the best bottle in your home and bring it along.  This small restaurant will welcome you as family.  The pasta Alex has a little bit of spice but is a must!  Listen for the daily specials as you may discover a favorite!  Perfect date night spot!

no6i9qkgMbF0PF93GLxG1A.text: We LOVE this place!!!!! The owner is so friendly and always remembers you. Homemade Italian pastas and the best bruschetta around!!! Last but not least BYOB with NO corkage fee!!! Definitely a favorite and a regular for date nights.

DjbWFg3qDu-G-SB57GtxXg.text: I'd been meaning to check this place out for a while and finally went for lunch. I ordered the baked ziti with a meatball. The meatball was big and delicious but instead of baked ziti I got some boiled ziti with marinara and a little bit of melted mozzarella on top. It didn't taste bad, but I don't think you can call it baked ziti if it doesn't have ricotta and wasn't baked.

8RrYkfcUO5hxVG0TlfyJ7A.text: We called in the morning for reservations for 10 people (7 adults, 3 children).  The reservation was taken and confirmed.  Because we had 3 different groups making up our party, we called again in the afternoon just to be sure.  When we arrived they were seating a large group at the only table set for 10 (which I will describe later in the review).  When I mentioned our name and earlier calls, they told the other party they couldn't have the table.  That party told them they had called the previous day and gave them the name of the person that took their reservation - complete chaos. The table was made up of different sized tables looking like Frankenstein's table and squeezed the 10 in with overlapping chairs in front of the rest room entrance.  We told the other party (of 9) they could remain seated and have the table. It was 5pm and many other tables were available and we asked if they could give us a larger location they said no!  The took no responsibility for their mistake. We left and after a wait at a nearby Italian restaurant, had a marvelous dinner - but what an inconvenience.  If you aren't known to the management - don't go!  They don't value new customers.

PlKCyGPaAoi1yJSE6XzdIg.text: Fabulous low key authentic Italian restaurant. Giuseppe himself made sure that every guest had the perfect experience. BYOB and cash only.

5IVz3qsLUyjin3ONOwaxxg.text: This place was really good!  We chose to go here for a romantic date which was a mistake... not that we didn't have a good time but it was not a romantic setting at all. The name sounded romantic to me. But it was the opposite of romantic. Loud, brightly lit, sassy servers, and children running amok. Reminded me instead of a raucous Italian family reunion. But still a good time!  I love that it's BYOB with no corkage fee. That itself is a great value on it's own.   We started with the bruschetta. We weren't planning on getting an appetizer but we were talked into it. Yes, the servers are a bit pushy with the upselling. But the bruschetta was tasty and bursting with fresh flavor so we were glad we did.  I had the eggplant rollettini and my husband had the pork Parmesan. The portions weren't as big as they are in other Italian restaurants. I was expecting leftovers to take home. But still very filling. My eggplant was very tasty but a bit salty. My husband and I both loved the marinara. It was very unique. I detected a warm seasoning to it... cinnamon or nutmeg? I don't know but it was good. My husband thought his pork was delicious. He said it lacked breading but was still excellent.  We will definitely return but we learned our lesson. Expect a casual and energetic good time with delicious food. We see this being a great spot for a double date... each couple bringing a great bottle of wine.

u_I1zXUuEgK3R_XKvAxF9A.text: Amazing personal family style service. The staff made us feel welcome and provided a fun warm atmosphere. I would go back in a heartbeat. I saw a complaint below that it was loud. Its a family style authentic restaurant so if you're surprised that it's loud you don't deserve to enjoy the delicious food and awesome service. If you want quiet atmosphere go eat some French food.   The food was fresh and authentic.They have fresh seafood saturdays.  Highly recommended

t8Wl6QKyp_zrFiZEjw2Aug.text: WOW! I can barely walk...SOOOOOOOOO full! Veal & Peppers was absolutely amazing...as were the home made deserts. Highly recommended going to give this place a try!  This is my new favorite Italian restaurant in the Valley! Remember to bring cash as they don't accept credit cards. Also, it's BYOB!

F94GDmwzXwhzLS1fC4DwoQ.text: If I give this place only one star, will it keep everyone from going to my favorite Italian restaurant? Giuseppe's is by far the freshest, most delicious Italian food in PHX. And--as if that weren't enough--the atmosphere and the owner Pascal make this feel like home. After a visit or two, Pascal will remember you, and a friendly smile will become a warm hug. I would like to say that everything I've tried is great, but in all honesty I order from a couple of favorites every time. The Pasta Alex with its addicting spicy and meaty flavors is superb. The cheese tortellini is cooked perfectly. The cardinale sauce is a must, and the bruschetta (whether the standard one on the everyday menu or one of the many daily special versions) adds the perfect touch. On top of all that, this place is BYOB with no corkage fee (although you may want to share a bit with Pascal to say thank you).

FKeEPSKjzJs4df_JeffXFg.text: The food is great. We've been coming here for 10 years and are always happy with the food. However we tend to agree with other yelpers who've identified some less than stand-up business practices when it comes to the bill. I think we'll be seeking other Italian restaraunts or deli/groceries in the valley.

w0cZzjunyju-6uYyJu6O_Q.text: Giuseppe's is really one of a kind. As soon as you walk in, you can tell that your experience is going to be great. You're warmly greeted by the staff and they give you a sense that you're almost walking into their home for dinner. That's the vibe that I got because of how welcoming the entire staff was. I had never been here before, but they make you feel as if you've been a regular for years.   The food. My God...the food! You must-I repeat, you must try the eggplant appetizer. Your life as you know it will never be the same. Don't bother wearing socks because they will be knocked off. Luckily, I wore sandals so I was ok. It comes with delicious garlic bread. Who doesn't love garlic bread, right? I got the Pasta Alex. The portion is huge! I had to take some home (it was good even warmed up the next day) It has a bit of a kick to it, not too much where you can't enjoy your meal, but enough to make sure you don't pass out from carb overload. Add this to your must try's.  You can bring your own booze! No more wondering if a place has this or that, you bring what you want! You'll need to sit down for this part. There is no corkage fee!! You read correctly, my friend. No fee. Nada.    You can't leave without trying their sweet treats of deliciousness! The cheesecake is amazing! Everything that they have there is made there. How cool is that?!   You really need to do yourself a favor and check this place out. I will be returning...with stretchy pants.

U3ZQhcHYCxU8gYmo3iOOGg.text: WONDERFUL food and WONDERFUL service, BUT, $11.95 for lettuce salad for 2, and an extra $7.00 to add mushrooms to my sauce. REALLY??????  Been here several times.  Unfortunately, the bill for dinner left a nasty aftertaste.

z6eemAlD4xlHNgUv_LpbuA.text: This was not my first visit to this fabulous restaurant that never disappoints. I am eating gluten free right now and they were very accommodating. They recommended the pork cacciatore.... can't find the words to describe it. Delicious!  I am not a big eater and typically eat about half of what I am served. Not this meal, I finished it all and was tempted to lick the plate clean! The pork was so tender, the sauce was robust, and they even added extra vegetables to the dish for me.   The owner is very friendly and you feel like you are dining in his home.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant and give it a two thumbs up.

GmuUFf5RTQVc5w4iPNs_Eg.text: I had a friend take me there for lunch today. This is the way it should be when you go to a small restaurant. Very personable owner. I'm not a big Italian food eater but this food was delicious.  Relax and enjoy. No seriously enjoy because the owner makes you want to just enjoy your meal and experience.  Other restaurants should go here to learn how to run a family restaurant

1YZ2d4vVCoythnlwK0OsBQ.text: Normally this would be a glowing review, but I feel compelled to warn fellow yelpers that we just had our second, and final, mysteriously excessively large bill. We have been going to Guiseppes for years because the food was amazing, it was BYOB, and the prices were reasonable. In November we went for a family celebration, ordered a similar amount of food as in previous visits, and our bill was almost $100 higher than the last time we had dined there. Even more surprising, the check wasn't itemized and it's a cash only business. The final nail in the coffin was just 3 days ago. A group of 12 of us went to dinner and ordered family style. We has bruschetta, antipasti salad(missing the meat) mushroom ravioli, pasta Alex, and chicken piccata. Somehow, in a restaurant with nothing higher priced on the menu than $18, our bill was almost $38 per person. Once again, we were handed a piece of paper with a number on it and nothing else.   It's a sad day when a once great restaurant succumbs to such a ridiculous money grab from longtime customers.

SCPKXbgZfpe-JD9xv6hH_Q.text: Best traditional pasta around. Meatballs are awesome. Great atmosphere. All of our important dinners are here. Cash only--so worth it.

ro8IZYpnen3eOSixmmqZJQ.text: Absolutely amazing! We have eaten here many times in the last few months. The service is wonderful and the food is delicious. We live about 45 minutes away and it is definitely worth the drive.

oFynPtqLg1ICfVpYLxnYow.text: By far the best Italian food you will find in the valley. My favorites include the eggplant rollatini, stuffed peppers, lasagna with meat sauce, spaghetti with meat sauce and meatballs. Bring cash and wine, and you're in for a spectacular experience!  PS- ask for the pasta Alex as your side pasta on the rollatini and peppers. It's phenom!

6wo4kFojU8uVzyuIu4iFTw.text: We love this place!  They know Italian food!  It's a fun atmosphere with red and white checkered table cloths.  Friendly.  Inexpensive. Cash only.  Bring your own wine.  The bruschetta is delish.  The lasagna bolognaise is very good.  Spaghetti and meatballs the size of baseballs.  One of our favorite places to go for sure.

Yof3qjc_pBsXGFVBkwHWlg.text: I have lived in this general vicinity for years and still never tried this place. Such a shame. GREAT authentic italian food, incredibly friendly staff who greet you, shoot the shit with you, and check up on you. Great place for a date night. Thanks guys, I will be back! PS, try the meatballs

uu5qODU6-NVBRX_UdalJwQ.text: A hidden gem! We love this family run restaurant and family. We have been eating here for over 5 years bringing our out of town guests and celebrating birthdays at Giuseppies. The food is excellent authentic Italian cuisine.

QUqqtHnm60wFH9rt27TrEg.text: My daughters 24th birthday and my moms 65th birthday was last Saturday night.  Daughter selected Giuseppe to celebrate on a referral.  Nine in our party, none of us had ever been there before.  Called ahead to see if I could bring the birthday cake in with us.  THAT was a mistake, I got a NO.  Once we were all seated our surly waiter came over and announced you all want bruschetta "it's good".  Same arrogance with salad.  We finally got menus after about a half hour.  We were enjoying our wine and yes it was busy and loud as expected for a popular restaurant on a Saturday night. Not sure why he was so  sarcastic...perhaps it was the pretty young girls at our table, making him nervous?  When they asked if we wanted dessert we reminded them (with gifts and flowers ON the table) that we were celebrating TWO birthdays and were told NOT to bring in our dessert.  At that point, a cannoli and a piece of cheesecake were "presented". The food was good, recommendations right on.  Prices fair and definitely a family feel about the place.  Next time we want to celebrate, we'll actually "try it before we buy it" so we'll know what to expect...

MWiPHuD7996rA9lnmDuvKg.text: My Mother is 100% Napolitano.  Giuseppe's serves all the food I grew up on!  I never knew there was a place I could eat sauce that tastes like home.  (not the Americanized Sicilian stuff that makes me wanna hurl) Besides all the typical red sauce dishes,  they have stuff like sausage and peppers, pasta fazul, eggplant parmesan and Cannolis!!! YES it's a hole in the wall in a  strip center, and yes,  they are busy so they won't be at your beck and call... Sorry Scottsdalians But if you're Italian... you can handle it.

y4bpdAAHrBWerYGhp_3KYQ.text: Great Italian food and has a home cooking feel! They give you bread at the start and at the end you get Lemmon cello. So good and a must go to place!

Y4USIrprQCBRMH-liyN9xw.text: Probably the best restaurant that I never will go back to.  Excellent food but it took 40 minutes to get our entree.  It was so crowded on a Wednesday night we were on the patio with no wine service and at the end of the meal we found out it was cash only. All meals did not come out at the same time. Felt forgotten on the patio.  Great meal. $80 for three. No wine. There is a compass bank in the parking lot. I had a service charge since I bank with a different bank but the owner is not paying any ATM fees or card charges. It's about $15 a plate so this should be built into the business plan.  It is 2014 -time to get ready for Apple pay. This ones a pass.

VZNH2XZqhfzPZXrAk3nmDQ.text: came here with my wife a week ago. I ordered the spaghetti with meatballs and she got raviolis. Both are great. Sauce was great and of course the meatballs are great. owner came and talked to us, great local feel and we are buying a house soon down the street so we will be back very often and be a regular.

UbSb0eAwsC87vA1i9VsEgg.text: Went to try this on Wednesday for my husband's birthday. Decided to forego our regular Italian restaurant. My husband ordered the cioppino and was told it is only available on Friday and Saturday. Then change your menu so that it is not under DAILY SPECIALS.  SO, he ordered the veal parmigiana which was ground veal and not a cutlet?  For $19.95, it should be a cutlet. My daughter ordered the ravioli, which is pictured, and it was bland and that dish should be $9.95 not $14.95 for 6 ravioli. But, as another reviewer mentioned, I do not like that the receipts are not itemized. We figured our bill to be $4 more than it should have been and it's cash only. It is a nice family owned restaurant with pictures everywhere, even on the tables. It is small so probably gets crowded quickly. But, my Italian taste knows now to stay with my regular one because prices are more reasonable, itemized receipts, takes credit cards and they are from my hometown Chicago.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

59aEBOGFQlGR8T21UTGWBQ.text: Absolutely my favorite place to take family and friends for the BEST ITALIAN food in Scottsdale.  Then you add the wonderfully warm and attentive staff and you can't beat Giuseppe's!  We start with the bruschetta, usually split the Giuseppe's Salad and then I always go with the Pasta Alex.  My son enjoyed the Fettucino Alfredo while my friend go the eggplant.  Everyone was blown away by their dishes and took home 2 boxes of leftovers.    Pasquale, the owner, was a gracious host and welcomed our out of town friends as they were family.  If you are looking for a fun night out with delicious food this is the choice.  We love it!

BRcpPfT7er59c-UtAKtvbA.text: Fantastic! My favorite Italian food in Scottsdale. It  has great food with friendly staff who will get to know you if you regularly return.   I get the spaghetti with meat sauce and it is amazing.

MKOVJCoSdyfK637uT5RpxQ.text: One og our favorite places, however management allowing a car to park on the handicap access ramp it rude, illegal, and shohld not be tolerated.   My father has Parkinson's disease and uses a walker. Shame on management.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JxTvawPfxuiEYKc84Iqg0w.text: Absolutely best Italian food in AZ. My family is Italian so we are Italian food snobs and this place is the best. Cash pay only and no cork charge of you bring your own wine.

Ng1R3qLYzyRPIMwWWohffA.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant of all time, the pasta Alex is spicy and delicious and you can also make anything else Alex by them putting the Alex sauce on lasagna or anything else.

R4VO-RTthpR9zJnckf0BYA.text: Everything was amazing! Save room for dessert (all made fresh daily), the tiramisu and cheesecake were fantastic! Daily specials were very good as well.

doeHG6OtDopaRllGaNeZ9w.text: We went for a friend's birthday with a small group and it was great. It is BYOB, which was perfect for us to bring a few bottles of wine. The food was delicious and family-style so we were able to order several items to try. We didn't want to leave at the end of the night. This was a one-of-a-kind dining experience we don't usually get in Scottsdale.  Thank you Giuseppe for making us feel like we were at your home for dinner!

tbtNrMVVjsYfootIubKIeg.text: Love the place. Authentic. Good food. No corkage fee. Great service. A bit of NYC Italian here in the desert. If you are looking for Scottsdale glitz and bling, this is not your place. Good food over your own best vino, welcome home.

QOLhzDCJjKplUj7tE0WFoA.text: The food is awesome, the staff is attentive and friendly and the cheese cake and tiramisu is the best I have ever had. BUT the best part of this dining experience is Pasquale. He is the proprietor of the establishment and he really knows how to treat his guests as family. Bravo to this local spot and if you haven't been there, you are missing out on the best dining experience in Scottsdale.

mY1YJTrbiS9dHAsyS8oWEQ.text: My family and I have been coming here for many many years and the food is always top notch. Pasquale makes you feel at home like family and his loyal staff has been with him forever. The eggplant parm, meatballs, and pork ribs parm are some of our favorites. Pasta Alex is a great choice too! Not a stuffy or fancy place and you may have to wait for a table as the place is small, but it's all worth it. Bring your favorite bottle of wine and enjoy an excellent meal in what will become your new favorite neighborhood Italian place.

3ShUPE5m9_xDUvVe9XbEEg.text: Strange Place. Fortunately I arrived early, before my business lunch meeting. I selected this place because my hairdresser raved about it. She obviously knows about cutting hair, but not about good Italian food. Upon entering, the first words uttered were: 'We only accept cash'. OK ... so I headed back to my car where I usually keep an extra $20. The food was mediocre, at best. As noted by previous reviewers, there was no bill - just a verbal amount told to me by the owner. I may return just to see if I am right about this place. If I am wrong, I will update the review. There is another Italian restaurant in the same complex.

B5D2EvQA_Iyl8tXdtKxFjw.text: Solid Italian food. Went here for my mom's bday dinner. Portions are good, staff is friendly and accommodating, and it's exactly what you'd expect for a homemade Italian family restaurant.   Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy Bday Mom!

fhJfrolNTPmUzYeehj7YrQ.text: We love Giuseppe's! We have been coming here for years...and it is consistent and delicious every time. Bring your own wine and just enjoy.

fVMSoIxQ_Ozb5sv5qwDgdg.text: We found this restaurant to be mediocre. The bread was stale,  And the food did not taste  homemade. But on the plus side owner and greeter is very congenial and gregarious. If you

X3dcYtq-nONpAKAqdpMFlg.text: Fantastic little place! This was our first visit and I could tell most of the other patrons were regulars. Everyone got a handshake or greeting by everyone on the staff.  The ambiance isn't upscale, but very warm and welcoming. My husband went with the waiters recommendation and he loved his dish (I don't recall the name, short ribs, mushrooms with pasta). My go to is generally Chicken Parmesan and I wasn't disappointed.  It is cash only, but that's not difficult. BYOB is nice, we can have a great meal without our bill doubling with a couple of drinks!  I highly recommend, we will become regulars!

inQROhvWzHkWqkBZYrOaJA.text: We just moved to North Scottsdale and hadnt unpacked the kitchen yet so I decided to check out Ristorante Giuseppe and get to go.  I have no idea it is CASH ONLY and only had my cards but the manager was super understanding.  I offered to hit the ATM at the bank in the complex but the manager didnt want me to incur the fees and told me to come back the next day with cash.  Not only was their hospitality amazing, their food was as well.  The fettuccine alfredo was rich and buttery without being too heavy.  I will definitely be back and won't forget my cash

0Ooflgxjw779IVVcHkzEcA.text: I can't believe I have not written a review for this place, not that they need one more.  I have been coming here forever.  This place is awesome, it's more like your old fashion Italian restaurant with the typical pasta and sauce choices.  They do a great job.  I also love that I can bring my own bottle of wine.  This is a cash only restaurant, only once I forgot, but thank goodness our bank has a branch on the other corner, so problem solved.  I have had almost all their offerings.  Last time I had the stuffed shells and they were delicious.  Also pasta Alex is very good.  For dessert the tiramisu never disappoints.

lXwPOXx9h-0qqgKtdR4ECg.text: My boyfriend has been trying to take me here for years... It's been years! But every time he brings up this place, I'm not in the mood for Italian. Since I've been under the weather this week, I decided to order takeout last night from here. I ordered the Pasta Alex and he ordered the Peppino Special. We also got a side of the garlic bread and the tiramisu. Tiramisu is my favorite dessert and I have the biggest sweet tooth. I was so excited to see it on their menu. My favorite place to get it at the moment is at Pomo Pizzeria.   With that said, I was disappointed with the tiramisu when I got home and got to see it. It looks like they soaked two lady fingers and then made a tiramisu sandwich with it by adding mascarpone cheese in the middle. Half of each lady finger was dry so it was kind of a sad dessert... Especially at $4.95.   The Pasta Alex was delicious. I would definitely get it again. I didn't bother trying my boyfriend's dish because it had similar pasta, just a different sauce. It was kind of intimidating as well because there were so many different chunks of meat in his order. I wasn't in the adventurous mood last night. The menu online said it is made with a loaded baked ziti and that was one of the reasons he ordered it. We thought it would be of penne or rigatoni or another pasta of that sort but it was the same pasta used in my dish. Not sure if he will order this dish again.   The garlic bread was just okay. Maybe it's something we need to dine in for but it just looked like it was covered in butter and paprika for color. I've had much better garlic bread elsewhere. Heck, I make better garlic bread! I'll give this place another try before I have a final decision about it. After all, it's just down the street and my dish was pretty good. Hopefully, I can increase the amount of stars at my next visit.

lxsOl2d1kTEKTcW_yqvc8w.text: My new favorite restaurant in Scottsdale! Visitng family for the holidays and this place was suggested by my brother.
