LOVED the food, ambience and the service so this will become a must on very future visit to Scottsdale. Everything was outstanding but the Pasta Alex was the favorite among the 5 of us.  Visited Italy earlier this year and we felt like we were there againlast night!

Jczn07P2eMK7wLPzzxo2sw.text: This was good. Really good. Not quote 5 stars, but really good. I ordered the special, which was pork Saltimboca. It was declious. Full of of flavor, and plentiful. I wasn't horribly impressed with the pasta that came on the side - pretty run of the mill boxed pasta. The pork was mostly very tender, but had a few tough/dry pieces. The delicious flavor made up for the few pieces of dry pork though.   My girlfriend ordered the Fettucine alfredo, and it was really good. There was plenty of sauce on the pasta, and I helped sop up the left over alfredo at the end with the garlic bread we ordered. The garlic bread was overcooked and burned, which is one of my pet peeves.   The price was reasonable. I would go back, but I wouldn't consider it to be the best value in town.

oweVz7KEhM2qomi1z94Z-Q.text: My wife and I went here with our 4yr old son. The food was awesome but service was lackluster.it took over fifteen min to get menus and the waiter seemed out of it. I will say he was ever only one and it was busy. We loved the fact that it was a non fancy come as you are place and food made up for the service. I should of read yelp before going as the no credit card was a surprise but they took a check so it worked out ok.i also did not know about the byob.i will try them again they deserve a second chance.

8A2ClLRDoJOxPTImRSbi7w.text: Called in a take out lunch, when I arrived the doors were locked... Someone opened it up for me and I entered the empty establishment and got my food.  The ambiance of the place seemed nice for the short time I was there.  Food however was a disappointment. I got the eggplant parm which is a favorite dish of mine. Didn't taste (or see) any fresh basil and the aromatics that I look forward to were completely missing. the cheese on top wasn't even browned at all. Looked like someone had piled together the pieces and nuked it or something. The eggplant wasn't crispy but I can't blame them since I did have to drive it home before eating it.  The tomato sauce with it was very chunky which could be  plus or minus depending on your preferences, but I wasn't really impressed with it. The included pasta was cooked to a very nice al dente.  Probably wouldn't come back.

L18MASiLeLDvocNP_3MjNA.text: I love coming here on Mondays night and any other night the food are always great and friendly staff and the most important thing is I love the food

lvfQQ49Q05ko8Us7f4aogg.text: Ristorante Giuseppe is pretty much everything it's cracked up to be based on previous reviews. My wife and I arrived about twenty minutes after the restaurant opened. Within fifteen minutes, the place was packed so I suggest arriving early if you want a table. The interior of the establishment is rather small and there are about eight tables outside.  My wife wanted to order the veal parmesan, however, we were informed that the veal is served in patty form rather than scallopini so my wife ordered eggplant parmesan instead. The eggplant was thinly sliced, very tender, and delicious. The sauce was not overly acidic and the portion was perfect. A ziti with sauce is served on the side. Had the ziti not been slightly underdone, I would have given this establishment a 5-star rating. I had the house special - Pasta Alex. This was served in a light cream sauce with Italian sausage pieces and had a spicy kick to it which I really liked. This dish is like Italian crack! My wife and I devoured every last bite and would have licked the plate if we did not have manners!  As other reviews have stated, there is no corking fee. Some guy even brought in a 12-pack of beer to enjoy (Coors Light? Couldn't you have brought in something better than THAT?)  Our waiter was very pleasant and the owner and his son came by frequently to see if everything was okay. I highly recommend Ristorante Giuseppe and will definitely visit this place often!

rwuTKSLbww0s-RiRHushMw.text: Let me start this by saying that the place is ok. The food is decent and the prices are ok....maybe a little on the high side for some of the dishes considering the location in an old strip mall.  However, my judgement of their prices must take into consideration the plethora of overpriced mediocre pretentious restaurants in the Kierland area.   My experience with Italian food is from growing up in San Francisco and eating at the neighborhood Italian joints, including those in North Beach. Also I have traveled Italy extensively.  I had the Spaghetti with Meat Sauce and one meatball.  The soup was pasta e faggioli.  We also had an order of garlic bread.  The soup was ok. The pasta in it was rigattoni that was properly al dente. That was promising.  The beans had the right consistency as well. The soup however, was not quite as hearty or flavorful as I've had in the past. Still, I would recommend it.  I'd give it a 5 out of 10.  The spaghetti noodles were of decent quality and just slightly past al dente.  Perhaps it's because americans like their pasta a little bit softer. The pasta I've had in Italy was really al dente.  The sauce was tangy but there was really little meat. I thought it was plain sauce until my wife pointed out a few spots of meat. To me, that's not really a meat sauce.  I like a sauce that has a bit of a kick to it.  This was more of a tangy  crushed tomato sauce. So overall the dish was a 5 out of 10.  The meatball had a lot of filler in it. It tasted good but you could taste the filler. But the bottom line was it tasted ok.  I'd give it a solid 5 out of 10.  The garlic bread was bad. Do NOT order the garlic bread. First of all, the bread was plain bread shaped like a roll. That's not proper. Get some good sourdough with a good crust at least.  There was very little garlic taste and it was not toasted enough.  Go to Ernesto's on 24th and Clement in San Francisco. They make GREAT garlic bread and it comes complimentary.  The service was earnest but plainly there is not enough wait staff. On a Sunday night, there was only the cook, one waitress/busgirl and one server/greeter.  It took forever to get our check. They were nice but plainly overworked. The solution would be to hire one more waiter.  Ambiance is meh.  It's an oasis considering the horrible shopping center it's in. But it's not North Beach Capp's Corner.  Throw some candles on the table at least. Spice the place up.  Clearly though, this restaurant has a following. It's usually crowded. I guess people need a casual place to eat away from the silicon breast and botox crowd over at Kierland Commons.  I will return again to try some of their other dishes and report back.

p92IR5-BbnCUzXFVlV-yog.text: I don't want to build up your expectations. I just want you to come to this restaurant, relax, and live in the moment. Because, every moment of your dining experience will be special.

25ZuS0g5PO9r2qOCutIGog.text: Great lunch spot...food is always the BOMB and owner makes it fun..pasta is super fresh!

OQ0ujWEVrzw5-YtEgFsjkQ.text: Amazing!!  My new favorite place!!!! I love the family run business with GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE. born and raised in Cali and live in the east coast so it truly makes me feel like home.  Coming from a large Armenian family this was great!!

bV5gupORt6-jGOV0otXlPw.text: I can't believe I have never tried this place until now. It's the best Italian Restaurant I have found since I've left upstate NY. It's a small little mom and pop place that's family owned. The chicken parmigiana, baked ziti, lasagna, and antipasto were yummy. Very tasty tomato sause.  The restaurant is BYOB and cash only but it's a must DINE!!

myLms1gB2QHyeccJ00JjRA.text: I am still thinking about this place and it's been 2 weeks since I ate there.  Maybe love at first bite?  Must be, because I am completely enamored.  The service wasn't that great but they made up for it with their delicious food.  I got the special, I don't even remember the name but I can't sing its praises enough.  Rotini noodles with a creamy white sauce and sausage...  If I wasn't on a date I would have eaten the entire plate.  To see a single noodle go to waste was a total shame but I really liked the guy.    Even though this place is a 20 minute drive from my house, I'll be back.

8ofBe_nnbGY6jygOXtZBeQ.text: Seriously love this place! My husband and I go here often and are always greeted by the owner Pasqual (sp??) who is so so nice!!  The Pasta Alex & Spaghetti are awesome!! Cash Only which is the biggest downfall but BYOB which is AWESOME!!

kpDU_IB6c7g7XiXg442urA.text: It's not fancy, but solid, basic Italian food at good prices and the servers were very nice.  The meatballs that people rave about were just "ok" to us.   If not for the BYOB policy on wine, I would've give it a 3 star rating, but we took a really good Pinot that would've cost a ton at restaurant prices.  Get there early or be ready to wait on a weekend.   Also bring cash - no credit cards!

kw9lh0f53kjd3pYkhRpqLw.text: Where has Ristorante Giuseppe been all my life??  Family-owned atmosphere, great food, and BYOB with no corking fee?  Sold!  I checked out this place for a date night last Friday, and was really quite tickled with the entire experience.  I had been to Arrivederci, an Italian restaurant in the same complex, for lunch several times before and never even noticed this small place just a few doors down.    While the atmosphere isn't cool, trendy or romantic, it feels warm, inviting and down-to-earth.  There was definitely an energy in the place that let you know you were among friends-of-Giuseppe's, and I liked that; it felt like we were discovering a well-loved secret.  We split the Giuseppe Salad to start, which was a pretty standard (eh) Italian-style salad that served two.  After some bread/garlic butter, we also split a pasta dish (rigatoni + tomato cream sauce + spinach and chicken) and the homemade tiramisu for dessert (was the best tiramisu I have ever had, and though it was smaller than most portions I have seen, it hit the spot).  I think our entire bill was ~$32, and I thought it was a great value.  Also, heads up -- CASH ONLY, no cards!  I liked the huge variety on the menu, but didn't realize all the mix-and-match possibilities until our server talked us through it -- so if it's your first time going, I would definitely let them know and ask them to take you through the menu.    I will definitely be going back to this spot to try to worm my way into Giuseppe's extended family  :-)

9nMNpoBI5Qolm-Z1s7qddQ.text: Amazing food and amazing service.  This place has a mom and pop feel, authentic and is very reasonably priced.

70GsHde8NGOWkT7BOEyfXQ.text: We used to go here all the time for the eggplant parmesan.  Each slice was individually breaded and then baked.  It was crispy and the sauce and cheese made it perfect. But no more. The last two times we went, they seemed to be cutting corners and the slices were soggy. What a disappointment. We haven't been back again since.

JrI8m0ps7H1ta4R465NyaA.text: I ordered my lunch over the phone, when i got there the doors were locked. I stood out there a couple of minutes before they open the door. I asked how much it was, they said $20.00. I said i don't know how you came up with that number. The cook kept saying $20.00. I looked at the menu and went over the items that i ordered with another guy that did not speak English and we decided on around $14.00, just to get out of there. This was for lunch spaghetti ($6.95), garlic bread ($2.50) and a meatball ($1.95), how that adds up to $14.00? This place was very weird and I will not be back. Food was mediocre. I agree with other reviewers that your bill should be itemized and tax included on the bill.

2RH62fr7CMFjsmSST0xZqQ.text: Found them on Yelp and what an excellent find for a family style Italian! Note, bring your own wine. They said it but I didn't see it but that's on me! Great experience!

7QAkhqw4S-dnLxWKv7QKPw.text: My boyfriend found this place when we were trying to figure out our last minute late dinner New Years plans. We had a 8:30 reservation and we were seated as soon as we walked in.  They offered no corkage fee, which is a nice plus, and had a set menu for New Years. $30 per person for 5 courses including a small dessert. Each course came out at a good time, our server was really watching and taking care of us.  I really enjoyed the food, the pasta and sauces were all amazing, and it was really great atmosphere. You could tell everyone who was in there was a regular, they all said goodbye to the staff as they left. We closed the place down at 10:30, but they didnt seem annoyed or that they were trying to rush us.  Excellent service and overall experience, we will be back and making this recommendation to others.

DsK1GKgE_y9qoI6RGhdCcA.text: Went here for the first time and this is the best Italian restaurant I've ever been too..  Small family business that cares about making sure your visit is the best it can be

_iZs3UGuWoucAVM83cRkkg.text: We love this place. Locals only please. ;  )  Good Italian home cooking.  The owners makes it all special.

oNbUFSRqxtE1S5bEcWI3eA.text: Great meal! This is a locals place-- Very busy. casual atmosphere and staff but very friendly. We brought our two kids and they loved it. No kids menu but they definitely were nice to our boys. Our seafood dish was loaded with seafood. They didn't scrimp one bit.

3C6dM2-0s0VpcPNQxfAlow.text: My wife and I stopped by the restaurant at about 1pm to be sure they would be open for dinner. Pasquale, the owner assured me they would be and suggested I come back as early as possible to avoid the crowd. When we returned at 4pm I was told they were not open until 5pm. No where in there advertising do I find this disclosed. Rather than sit in the hot sun for an hour we drove to Houston's for dinner. This was terribly inconvenient. Pasquale could have mentioned this rather than tell me to come back as early as possible. They don't care - they have more business than they need. I will never go back!

uV9xeuYAbWEviaSFknKs0A.text: Good find in Scottsdale. Family run Italian food with good prices and servings appropriate to the price. In other words, not too much and not too little. Mostly pasta dishes served in tasty sauces. The Meat Ravioli's were very good and the Stuffed Shells were excellent, and both reasonably priced in the $10-$12 range, with a side link of Mild italian Sausage for under $2. The Bruscetta appetizer special was $5, and came with 4 sliced of toasted bread with ripe tomatoes, basil and fresh Parmesan, with a delicious olive oil drizzle.  The restaurant has the feel of an upscale pizzeria, decoration and table-wise. Located in a strip mall, it is not a place to impress a first date with the decor, but a nice place to take someone for a good Italian meal without breaking the bank. The service was very pleasant and efficient. It goes without saying that being able to bring your own wine without a corkage fee in North Scottsdale in not only unheard of, but a fantastic way to keep your evening's cost down to your comfort level. We will definitely be returning. A great start to a night out before seeing a movie.   They advertised that they close at 8:30pm on Saturday, but we walked in at 8:25pm and they did not blink an eye, and seated people as late as 9pm.  Reservations are only needed for larger groups (they wouldn't take one for two people). Be warned though, they do not accept credit cards, so hit an ATM before coming with your favorite bottle of wine.

uau4YDIS3WW7FXMc_sdPKg.text: I was really excited when I heard this was so close to me. I had been to the one on 28th and Indian School before and had no idea this one existed. We were waited on by Giuseppe and it was a very enjoyable experience. I ended up having the manicotti which was very good. I also had the opportunity to try their meatballs (also excellent) and the tiramisu (it, too, was delicious!). The pricing is pretty good, not much more than some big chain restaurants, and you're supporting a locally owned business in the process. Be forewarned (as we did not know this) it is a CASH ONLY establishment! No credit or debit cards accepted. I would recommend this to anyone who hasn't been before and wants to try something new, with a good atmosphere, just remember to bring cash!

k_65NxqHVRBXVeTkBJtlKQ.text: I'm married into an Italian family and this is their dinner of choice for any sort of special occasion. I've never been disappointed here and can honestly say I wish we ate here more. For authentic italian, this is the spot! Hmm maybe for dinner tonight...

ixlaIQgkxEeamUjDUTQDdw.text: Cody is a fabulous waiter! He brought us some Alex Sauce from the Pasta Alex....oH I thought I had died and gone to heaven! I had the chicken parm...oh so delicious and a huge portion. This is a BYOB place with no corkage fee!  You will definitely not go away disappointed!

WywCVp-410e2XFH9mvANPQ.text: What a fun evening!  This was our first time and we loved it.  Giuseppe is a True Italian from Naples and he has created such a fun atmosphere.  The place was packed and everyone seemed happy.  It is so nice to be able to bring our own wine instead of paying $70 for a $20 bottle of wine.  The food is fresh and tasty.  Giuseppe has adopted the American version of Italian food but it all tastes so good.  This is not like Andreolis where Giovanni still prepares dishes just as you would find them in Italy but it is really good.  I had the lasagne which was first rate.  My father-in-law had the veal parmigian which was excellent.  The others had pastas with the marinara sauce--all delicious.  We topped it off with tiramisu and Cannoli which were both wonderful.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because I save that for the restaurants that serve truly authentic Italian food.  Finally our waiter made the evening so much fun.  He employed my daughters to serve other tables while we waited.  He joked with us without being obnoxious.  He's the guy who looks a lot like Jesse in Breaking Bad.  I absolutely recommend this place.  You will have so much fun and the food is great.

2GRj97CGcmABBVJcFQJvVA.text: Our family had a great experience here.  Service was outstanding without being overbearing.  Food was incredible and the overall atmosphere was very enjoyable.  Bring your own bottle of wine - no corking fee!

-JwsDSSSu3es-bCFUQ8_oQ.text: I took my girlfriend here for our first Valentine's Day together. I was looking for my "Lady and the Tramp meatball moment."   Instead, I came away underwhelmed.   I believe much of my issues stem from the prix fixe menu that was available, but there were other problems as well.   The service was average at best. I forget our servers name, but she rattled off the entrees, brought us our bread, and then expected us to order. We were both a little shocked. Personally, I felt rushed all evening and I had to work against the servers to slow the evening down.   The ambience was less than ideal. Italian music played oh-so-faintly in the background. The lights were up all the way. No candles on any of the tables. We at least got the wine glasses promptly (though the provided wine key had a really loose hinge), though our wine was so-so (a custom labeled zinfandel I had got from a different place. Great label, average wine).   These issues were important to setting the mood for the evening, but we still had to eat. I had high expectations for the food, especially given the large number of very positive reviews from other Yelpers. However, the food did not live up to expectations.   The gnocchi I ordered was pillowy soft, exactly the way it's supposed to be, with wonderfully flavorful sauce. Alli's dish, a chicken piccata, was long on chicken, short of pasta, and the lemon sauce was only okay. In short, the presentation needed work.   Again, I think the problems with the food stemmed from the prix fixe menu. Under normal circumstances, I'm sure Ristorante Guiseppe serves wonderful, authentic, full-blooded Italian food, but this time, the experience felt rushed, cheap, and quick. In summation: not the Valentine's Day ambience one is trying to create.  I am very willing to give it another shot, but I would not recommend Ristorante Guiseppe for a special occasion.

7EdCxXgPxM8fBKF92I4FZw.text: We love this place. My boyfriend is a big fan of Italian food and for his bday I wanted to take him somewhere that had delicious Italian food. I came across the yelp reviews for this restaurant and decided to check it out. We were not disappointed. It felt like a neighborhood restaurant. As we were sitting at our table, an older gentleman walked by on his way out and wished us a good dinner and told us he had been coming there for years, I can't remember but I think he said 20 years or something. I love that you can bring your own wine and if there is a corkage fee at all, it is very minimal. The food is delicious and the desserts are prepared by the mother of two of the servers. It is close as I am going to get to having an Italian grandma make me dinner. We went for NYE and it was a super deal.  7 course meal for $37!  If you are looking for a fine dining atmosphere you won't find it here but if you want casual good Italian food, where you are often served by members of the family who owns the restaurant, you will love it.  One thing to note is that they close quite early, like at 8:30 pm I think.

ZP3yduHw1JLMoFGx-PXFtg.text: Tremendous restaurant - all things on menu are my favorite! Pasquale is the owner and always makes it a great experience.

oHEuA4lsVV8M8RYhQ0BcBg.text: We went by on a Friday night, it wasn't too busy. We ordered the night special salad to share. The caesar salad just didn't taste like any caesar I've ever had, way too much oil. We waited for ever for any bread to come. My boyfriend ordered a Sprite and never got it. And finally when the waiter noticed, he didn't want it anymore.   On to the main course, which I will say the food is good. I had the Alex Special, which was the perfect combination of spicy and creamy. My boyfriend ordered the seafood pasta and he said it was really.    Overall, the food is good, but the service is terrible. This place is by far not cheap and a certain expectation is set when your pasta dishes range from $13 to $17.

d1XIgWClCOMnIHDbd5PiVw.text: This place it the real deal! Pasquale and his family will provide you with amazing hospitality as you eat some of the most authentic Italian food you can get outside of Italy. Meatballs the size of a softball, pasta cooked to a perfect al dente and amazingly fresh ingredients make this place shine.   My favorites..Peperonata for appetizer and the pasta Alex for a main. They only take cash here, but it is BYOB and no corkage fee which is fantastic. Our server was telling us that his mother made all of the desserts and boy were they delicious. The New York Cheesecake was the table favorite. It was so smooth and creamy and had the perfect moisture and texture.   Bring an empty stomach and be ready to have a great time at Ristorante Giuseppe's!

3TmF3zuH2-cxVUOBwE90Jg.text: My parents and I are regulars. The food and family are awesome. Get the Pasta Alex!!!

Gq4yDI4rdWcWFpUVw15rnA.text: I had been here for 5 min and already knew I would be back... The owner is a straight shooter with a ton of energy. Pictures of him with family, friends, customers, athletes, etc cover the walls and the tables. Open kitchen so you can see the chefs in action.

sqwjE9-uo8McjkwgmdgZeQ.text: Fabulous family owned Italian restaurant. My boyfriend introduced me to it and now I'm hooked. Traditional and great atmosphere.

bO0bt11rz6bRfd16nZgLJA.text: Don't quite get the reviews. Food was good, but not great.  Place is tiny and only takes cash. Service was barely there and food was slow to come out.  However, we would have considered going back except for what happened once we got the bill.  It was a hand written ticket with nothing but a dollar amount.  Nothing was itemized including the tax.  When we asked for a brake out, he wouldn't do it.  When we asked how much the tax was, the guy at the register said he wasn't sure! What?? didn't want to make a scene so just paid and left. Mostly, what I hate is that establishments like this are probably collecting taxes from it's patrons, but never actually paying their fair share.  Never going back.

4-8vn0GwOVnYskf71sTDvw.text: Love this place and thus family run business! This is the real guiseppes ! We have been going here for years !

5BhiVM6sfcvmiNzWn0gX3g.text: 2 stars because at least two dishes were ok.  First, bring your own alcohol. I thought that was neat since they must not have a liquor license. So bring own fave bottle of wine as I did.   When we entered we were greeted and asked to sit outside. There were at least 5 empty tables inside but I guess we were supposed to ignore that. Once they saw though that we had our own bottle of wine, we were then escorted inside bc I guess you can't drink outside...?  Our biggest disappointment was the waiter. He was a typical example of someone having a bad day and showing it instead of brushing it off and taking care of business. Either that or he was in a state of perpetual bitterness. He was short, never smiled and never asked how the food was or if we needed a refill. So my husband's water was not refilled the entire time and our experience was not appreciated.  Now if it was just a matter of waitstaff, we would venture another visit, but the food was also subpar.  We ordered bruschetta and that was actually something to write home about. The tomatoes were fresh and it was sure tasty. We also ordered the eggplant and tortellini. Eggplant was delish! The tortellini however tasted like it was out of box and the sauce out of a can. It was nothing special and they should just 86 it. We did see other food orders that looked great, but I wonder if the taste matched the appearance.  We spent over $50 and were sorely disappointed. Keep in mind I'm no Scottsdale snob, but would choose Olive Garden any day over this place.  Also, a star should go to the young lady bussing tables. She was one of the few who seemed genuine and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

IFuw4NJFWq9VKP4P6rWWOg.text: Not what it used to be. Had diner last night. The chicken parmigiana was ok. The angel hair pasta on the side was clearly just sitting around. It was mushy and over sauced. The eggplant rolatini was ok. But both orders came out cold and needed to be sent back to heat up. The linguini with clams had very few clams. Feel really bad having to write this but there are so many choices for Italian food that we are more than likely done here.

59hKxoV3x91qKTM3M-UrmA.text: This place is a mom and pop style family Italian joint - with the red and white checkered tables, homey decorations, and family photos on the tables.  Service was good, prices are very reasonable, and food was tasty. Friend and I ordered the garlic bread (a little dry), dinner salad, veal Parmesan and Pasta Alex. My friend finished the entire plate and really enjoyed it. My pasta was delicious and a generous portion that I had left overs.  I wish I would have read that it's BYOB. Love the concept, but missed out on bringing a bottle of wine for the occasion.   Also, cash only!

jU3ulCg6j_NLFTEcnKikvw.text: The food was great but they could definitely invest in getting a bigger space. It is so crowded which in reality is a great thing for the business, but a little uncomfortable for the customer.

AejPtjY5spoykQEwxPcrOg.text: Loved the ambiance, friendliness and authentic feel and flavors at this cash only, alcohol free ( you may bring your own/no cork fee ) Ristorante.  My party of 5 ordered different items & enjoyed them with one exception which was the Pasta "Alex" which on the menu was described as including spicy sausage but the sauce itself was incredibly hot even for my fellow diners who love hot/spicy foods. I changed my order & was accommodated with stuffed shells that were nice. I will visit again on my next trip to AZ.

-BJG2CWFaykXN0HSk1GCYg.text: OMG amazing italian.   I can't go much because I would Gabe to much weight. .   Privately owners and it seems like the owner knows every customer if you go I'm sure you will meet him or his family.  This is and awesome dinning experience.

jTvi5syT1CO2PkMF3jlFKA.text: Food is really good. The sauces are fantastic...The reason I went with 4 instead of 5 stars  1)The check hasn't any breakdown....say a table of 4..1 gets eggplant parm one gets pasta with 1 meatball 1 gets linguini and clam sauce and the other just gets bruschetta....now 2 have desert..........the check you receive hasnt any break down it would just say 89.95 for example  2)CASH ONLY , I can say speaking for myself a few times I was there I would have ordered more and had desert if I could have used my card. It just seems very very limiting but given how long Giuseppes has been in business clearly it works for them  If neither of these items bother you then a five star

YUPnuHXSoa9TYDyBzHW3xA.text: First, I will say the food is very delicious, and homemade tasting, cooking from the heart.  My reason for the rating is because the last 3 times we've eaten here we have felt like a huge inconvenience.  Granted they are a busy restaurant with loyal regulars (I would consider us regulars as we eat here every time we are in town) but the greetings have almost seemed like we are an annoyance. No one wants to feel like that when patronizing a restaurant.  We are in town again but we are going to try another Italian restaurant-not a chain- down the street.  We may find a new go to.

8d9IqnukvnrHZk6VlihaVg.text: Don't let the strip mall setting fool you, this is a neighborhood joint that is worth the visit. We have been to Ristorante Guiseppe's in Scottsdale, AZ twice now, and both times, the food was terrific! You know that it is a local place when the drinks are BYOB and they only take cash - no credit cards. Knowing that, we came ready with wine in hand and a recent trip to the local ATM!  The food is best served family style as the dishes are plenty and that way you can share and taste several options. We started our meal with their Bruschetta that was nice and garlicy, topped with oodles of tomatoes and cheese on nice crusty bread. We shared their Guiseppe's Salad tossed with a wonderful Italian vinaigrette and lots of goodies abound. Their Pasta e Fagioli was the best I've ever had! Creamy and full of flavor.  For mains, our table ordered Stuffed Peppers, Lobster Ravioli and Eggplant Parmigiana. We're talking good old style comfort food. No pretense, no glitz and glamour. Just good honest food. The pasta was perfect, sauces were delish and everyone was enjoying every bite. No leftovers here!  Our service was attentive even though the place was hopping. Expect to become part of their family; that's how it works there. Yes, this is definitely on our repeat list for Scottsdale. We will be back!

6IKewtpSUEkr95yQ5oYBcA.text: Every single time I come here the service is incredible and the food is even better.  And how can you not appreciate BYOB.  Pasta Alex, cioppino, Alfredo, pasta fazul, bruschetta...the list could go on...every time I come here is fantastic.

K8ltE_72UHBzLkqMbcd4Yw.text: I really want to love Giuseppe's. So much so that I went once a few months ago, tried it but wasn't too impressed, and then tried it again today. Also this place is cash only and you must BYOB (I love the BYOB part). The staff is so sweet, particularly the owner, and the restaurant is unpretentious. And with how crowded this place can get on Friday/Saturday night, you can tell that this place is a local favorite. However, I just don't enjoy my food as much here as a lot of other Italian joints in Scottsdale. The first time I went, I ordered pasta with vodka sauce and today I got spaghetti with vegetables and  Alfredo sauce. I do not recommend getting the pasta with vegetables... The veggies are a strange mix of baby carrots, broccoli, cauliflower, and something else (almost like a store-bought steamed veggie mix). The pasta itself seems good quality and the sauces are tasty (though not exactly made with fine ingredients). If you do go, I would recommend getting the pasta Alex as I've heard it's really good. Unfortunately I can't eat it because I'm vegetarian.

gKZSOO9KKyGmKOV3AD_T8Q.text: We ordered 2 meatballs...bruschetta...and toasted raviolis to be delivered next door at Mesquite river brewery.  The meatballs were ice cold!  We were too embarrased to see if they could microwave them.  The raviolis were as hard as a rock...could break a tooth.  Only good thing was the bruschetta ....although it was also ice cold and bread was hard.  We will get food at the hangar next time.

V_qFG2BpdnvVCjx47GzC9Q.text: First, the food was okay (though too salty), but the rave reviews are hard to understand. Nothing special, and bread was stale and horrible. The rudeness factor totally unacceptable though. First ones there, were four of us. We had salad first, which was limp and soggy. We were there for about an hour and half and by the time we left it was busy, with one party waiting. The owner actually came over to us and (rudely) told us we were there long enough and there was someone waiting for table so we had to leave. Before we could even respond, the table was cleared. If we were asked nicely, might have been different, but the food was certainly not good enough to put up with the rude owner. And by the way, cash only policy is annoying, surprised the IRS isnot all over this place! Obviously, I will never go back.

Y6MfgQP2OyO8fgis83-98A.text: I think the entire restaurant was staring at me when I took the first bite of their linguini Alfredo.  App entry they thought that something was wrong when I kept saying Oh My God.  Pretty sure their Alfredo is one of the best I have ever had.  And don't even get me started on the cheesecake that the owners wife makes from scratch.

2ZKHFl3YJwBpnfecZziXfg.text: The greeting we received was the most rude treatment we have ever encountered.  I would not eat here even if it was free.  Terrible attitude, we walked out.....

q6iZ-ppEAa42Wx9j-XYMcg.text: If I were writing a review after our first experience at Ristorante Giuseppe with our friends, the rating would have been easily 5 stars. After our first visit I let as many people as possible know that we had found a wonderful Italian ristorante that not only served great food, but you could bring your own wine and not pay a corkage fee. All four of us couldn't wait to return.   That being said, our second visit left us angry. The food was still exceptional. The issue came when the bill arrived. As stated in reviews here, the bill is not itemized or printed on a receipt but rather numbers are scribbled on a ticket. The number on the bottom of our check was 57.85 and it was circled. The rest of the check was not legible. We put in 80.00. A few minutes later the waiter brought the check back and said, as an accusation,  "Hey, you shorted me".   Turns out that there were two totals on the check, the $57.85 and another total for 36.90. When we asked for a break down we were told that there were two $5.00 corkage fees...the rest we couldn't understand as he mumbled a few sentences and hurried away. We paid the bill, though we still do not understand why there was a 20.00 difference between us and our two friends. Our meals all cost the same, the only difference was that my husband ordered a side meatball and a side salad...according to their website the meatball is 1.95 and the salad is 2.95. Not even close to 20.00.  As the owner was passing by, we asked when they started charging a corkage fee as there hadn't been one a few weeks prior and his website states no corkage fee. He seemed to be insulted by our asking. His response was the website was outdated and that he had to pay for wine glasses.   OK. No big deal. Question answered. But he then, very loudly, told the table behind us that we were complaining about the fee. We were not, we were asking for clarification. Then from several feet away, it's a very small restaurant, also very loudly, he adds that if the money was too much for us, he would take it off the bill. He repeated this several times...making sure that all of his customers heard him. He was not only incredibly rude, but very aggressive and insulting in his effort to embarrass customers who dared ask a simple question. Never before have I felt so insulted by a business owner.  If you want delicious Italian food, do not care how you are treated or rather mistreated, and have no problem contributing to shady business practices ( in addition to charging whatever they want, Giuseppes is CASH ONLY, NO PRINTED CHECK OR RECEIPTS...so no paper trail...thinking they are somehow always in the red come tax time), then this is the place for you. Personally I will stick to establishments that treat their customers with respect. I am including a snapshot taken from their website that states, boldly I might add, that there is no corkage fee. I believe that is called False advertising.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8XKiHCS1WdT-kIZcUBDLNg.text: I have lived in this area for 3 years and I'm sad I haven't discovered it before! Very authentic, the food is amazing! Marinara sauce has so much flavor. The prices here are great and the owner and staff are genuine and friendly! This is also a cash only restaurant.  I highly recommend!

_KLT8SpQrFRlhrYr0T4hfA.text: It was not a good evening for Italian. The meatballs contained very little meat. I was very disappointed in the pasta.  A fastfood Italian place.

oXMXAqrJzo0KZ4BrYFpuXw.text: Not to be believed!  We ate their last night ......Owner gave me a snippy comment upon arriving.  Service was atrocious......not to mention how long it took to get our food (45 minute)  Oh did I mention the food ....horrible!!!!!  Had to hunt down our server in order to pay.  How about this ....He only takes CASH....really?  I'll never return !!!!

m4qDZcoml5BhZSWtAlwhyg.text: Food was amazing, prices were extremely reasonable and the owners personally came to our table several times to ensure that everything was to our satisfaction. This is truly an authentic Italian restaurant where you feel like you're part of the family. They will definitely have repeat business from me.

AKHL_n15e3mMVy96vB9KeA.text: Giuseppe's is great Italian food! The deserts are home made I believe daily and the food is always fresh and delicious. They are great about making you exactly what you want. The tortellini is my favorite, but everything I have had here is great.   If you are looking for a relaxed, authentic Italian lunch or dinner are Scottsdale Rd and Thunderbird this is the place to go!

8o0V2G40Wsc3YFsf-LVdBA.text: Holy yum, I could eat here every day. Randomly went here last week for the first time and it was love-at-first-bite. This restaurant is authentic family-style, there are photos of the family on the walls and under the glass table tops. The service was amazing; our server was one of the sons and he never stopped smiling.  We tried the stuffed shells, the eggplant parmigiana and the Caesar salad. It was all delicious. The Caesar dressing had a hint of olive oil, the eggplant parmigiana was thick and tender and the stuffed shells are now absolutely my favorite thing ever.  There's no bar, BUT you can bring your own bottle of wine and they will serve you without a corking fee.   Note for the owners: Your joint is amazing. I love the traditional, down-to-earth feel but it could really benefit from the convenience of a credit card machine. I wanted to take my boyfriend here this weekend but we didn't have cash on us. Please, please start taking credit/debit cards.

pGyMDA5bT-KouEHHl-3WnQ.text: I would honestly go all the way back for more of their cheesecake alone, it was THAT good! I found this place on Yelp before we went up to Scottsdale and believe me it was so worth it. The prices were fair and the food was excellent! Next time though I will remember to bring my own wine, like many of the other customers had. It was a quite and small restaurant and even the staff was very friendly, they made you feel like you were a regular and were truly interested in making sure you were happy with everything you got.    I ordered the special spinach and ricotta ravioli with a cream, whine and tomato sauce-it had great flavors and everything came together nicely, the only thing I would change is maybe cook the ravioli a tad bit longer because mine was a little hard but it still tasted great! My boy friend got the special which was the  Franco Special which is  pasta cardinale (pink sauce) with pork rib-meat and spinach. He absolutely loved it and would barely let me have any and I kept wanting more. No complaints at all with this dish! and last but not least we had the cheesecake with a cup of regular coffee. The cheesecake could not be any better. It was homemade and so creamy and the perfect level of sweet. We were "sharing" but I'm pretty sure I ate most of it. The coffee was dark and super rich, I personally like my coffee a tad sweeter but it was "very smooth and easy to drink" according to my boyfriend who is borderline coffee addict, so I'm thinking it was actually really tasty like everything else the offer here.   I am so in love with this place I will make sure we go every time we are up in Phoenix/Scottsdale area and he said he would have no complaints either.

uqzWaEvGHURgm9esCAN66w.text: Amazing!  Had the dinner special and eggplant rollatini!  To die for as it melted in you mouth!  Pastas cooked just perfect and sauces were amazing!  What a gem!  You have to try this place out. There is even some outside dining space. Delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggplant rollatini

ZuMgC1KZvjqfPmZFK0yqEA.text: I am in LOVE with this place. The atmosphere, the food, the service, the small hole in the wall that it occupies, this place is quite the treat. The few times I have been here I most definitely was not disappointed! Arrive early, the place fills up quickly. Even with a full house I have never waited more than 10 minutes to sit down. The wait staff is courteous and the food is to die for! Also: BYOB with no corkage fee! Always remember though that this place is cash only!

OyuFN1f3e89uSpQuPG7aYg.text: My family and I have been coming here for several years and it's simply the BEST.  The food and service are spectacular, the prices are reasonable & we LOVE that they don't charge a corkage fee.  Love that they keep their prices reasonable by not accepting credit cards & focusing their expenses on quality ingrediants.  It's also clear that they take good care of their employees.  Who could ask for more?  We'd eat here every night but for the calories!  I'd give them 6 stars, if I could.  Bryn and Andy DeFusco

NgszuQEF1lgTebhUDBWGJg.text: Consistently the best Italian meals!! I have enjoyed every dinner and it is a great place to bring family or a date.  Bring a nice bottle of wine with you and enjoy home-made Italian dishes.  The cheesecake is worth saving room for!

EArzT3CUZZ-KogWMMEzTVA.text: Nice friendly staff, Good food!  Gets busy quickly.  LOVED the  Meat Sauce!  Will definitely will stop again to try something different. This time I had the veal cutlet which was a veal patties and not "real veal slices" but it was good. I would prefer to had the real thing though for the price of $ 15.00.    CASH ONLY so leave the plastic at home.

JAL1oFjdf4CbV_5J_6qFYg.text: Have them cater for you!  You get their delicious food to share with your entire family...and you will save $$$!  Great for dining in too!

iYReDrnQGFpV1fWA74EoRg.text: Absolutely, positively the BEST! I was told to go to Guiseppe's for the Pasta Alex by a man who works in food and beverage sales here in the valley. My expectations were very high because of how my friend lit up when he described this place. From start to finish, my first experience was flawless. I walked in and literally heard a table towards the front of the dining room arguing in Italian with each other, pinch me! I was welcomed, the owner introduced himself to me, showed me pictures of his kids on the wall and described the specials. I told him I thought the special with braised pork shoulder sounded amazing, but that I promised a friend is try the pasta Alex. He said in a thick Italian accent, "I'll take care of you son". He arranged a version of the special with the pasta Alex sauce and a small side of pasta Alex which I ate until my plate was spotless, thanks to the fresh bread.  I could go on all day. I've been back 10 times and had equally rewarding experiences. I've sent several friends in and they've all said the same. If you go and don't enjoy it, either you don't like good food or you have a psychiatric condition and should seek medical attention. In that case Mayo is just up Scottsdale Rd.

F6_3tysD3-o5XUpGQerRGQ.text: Always the best food and people. Never have I left this restaurant without a full belly and a smile on my face. If you have never been before it's an absolute MUST!

FZSsT2L1yOH87BzvjKGYqg.text: Excellent food.  Seriously some of the best Italian food I have ever had.  Price is good and it is even worth the extra step to get cash ahead of time especially since eating there doesn't break the bank. Great atmosphere and incredibly friendly service.

LS2SCba6y_L49egtYqYGnQ.text: This place is on my short list of things and places I miss most about Scottsdale since moving to PA.  We used to eat here all the time.  In fact my wife and I had dinner here the night before having our first child.  Pasquale (the owner) told her that Olive Oil would help induce labor and he wasn't lying!  The menu doesn't change from lunch to dinner and its also a BYOB, but that's OK because Pasquale and his staff make you feel right at home.  Indoors or on the small patio out front the food isn't fancy, but it doesn't have to be.  Good Italian about food, family and fun.   Insider's tip!  Still hungry, ask for a little more (its often on the house).

VqvGd7aA7oALWVzjcfU2WA.text: I have been going to Giuseppe's for years and years.  This is the real deal.  No place quite like it in Scottsdale or Phoenix.  Yes, I know there is another one.  I used to go there when Pasquale owned that one too.  It's ok, but it is not the real, honest to goodness one that Pasquale owns and runs.  You feel like you have just stepped off a plane to Italy...the Naples region actually.  The olive oil is not like any other you will get anywhere.  My personal fav is the eggplant rollatini.  I always start with the pasta fagioli, a Giuseppe salad.  I love this restaurant and the family that run it.  A must go place for any and all visitors.   PS  the desserts are made by his wife or mom.  YUM!

s0RjyrP--4sjZntJCCz_tQ.text: I brought my boyfriends family here and had an amazing experience. This was my first time here and was blown away by the food and service. The owner made us feel as though he's known us for years and made sure we were very well taken care of. You are missing out if you do not try this byob restaurant at least once.

SAJU0h9-Jy4G_6GgVBuCxg.text: Why is it that we try a place, love it and then forget about it as we go to the same old places? WELL...after a year or so I decided to eat dinner here tonight. YUM!!!!!!! I forgot how good the food is here. If you are looking for a high end, snobby typically overpriced Scottsdale restaurant, this is not your place, however, if you are looking for delicious food, wonderful, warm and friendly staff along with the owner Pascuale and his son Giuseppe, this is the place to go. We had the bruschetta, fresh tomato, garlic and high end olive oil...SOOOO good, then the Ravioli with Cardinale sauce ( Alfredo sauce blended with homemade marinara sauce)  and spaghetti and huge meatballs  with the most flavorful marinara anywhere. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, only about 12 tables so get there early. You feel like you are eating with family. Try it, you will like it, I did. I will not forget to go back soon.   If you don't love this place, then you don't know great Italian Food.

VZppFRWCQgThM_L4rSg0OA.text: Normally, this is my favorite place for Italian food.  We went here back in the beginning of July and were just overall disappointed.  I normally get the Peppino Special, but this time it was dry, and the pasta was not ziti.  My wife had the pasta alfredo with sliced Italian sausage, and again it was kind of dry, and almost looked reheated instead of fresh.  Order a side of garlic bread, which when we opened it back at home was burnt on top.  I will say the pasta & faggioli was spot on, so there was some saving grace.  I normally leave this place craving more, not sure what happened this time.  Didn't see the normal family members present when we were there.  I hope this was just a fluke.

wu-kGI1Q9rbSgLWejvpUcA.text: Most delicious white sauce I've ever had in my life!!! Their Caesar salad is out of this world! I love them.. Never had anything that was even so so there.. Everything is fantastic! Don't forget to bring cash! And you can bring your own wine or beer! Fun atmosphere..

WN-hQl3uGzs55BDdeCFfXA.text: Very good and super friendly service!  Everything was delicious with the staff being totally awesome!  Thanks!

OJWtMCizf9kq0uO6qNpzjA.text: Talk about as AUTHENTIC as you can get here in AZ.  I've never been to Italy but one bite of that brushetta made me believe that tasted so good.  When you walk in it has the old school feel   Owner is very friendly and makes you feel at home   Very family feel

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

k_LzRxI8PyLBaAP3kp8u1w.text: I came to the Phoenix area on vacation from New Jersey and was looking for a family owned Italian restaurant when this was recommended to me.   I ordered 2 chicken parms to go and was told it would be ready in 10 minutes. Everything came as ordered and the portion sizes are generous.   Everything from the marinara sauce to the chicken was amazing! It all tasted fresh! And you can tell it is made with quality ingredients. This restaurant lives up to real Italian food.   I highly recommend this place. The only reason why I gave it 4 stars was because it's cash only. I never have cash on me so this can be an inconvenience to some.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Complimentary bread
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. To go chicken parm with spaghetti
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. To go chicken parm with penne

psq8uqNBSLeAd5n7dUOE6Q.text: Wanted to eat here and stopped  by to say hello to check out this restaurant for dinner after lunch rush.  The reviews have been great  and made a special  stop to see Giuseppe's.   I assume owner (believe the owner) was either annoyed, just short and somewhat rude to us and outright not very warm to new customers.  Not very inviting to want to go there.  We were Not out of line in any way.  We just wanted  to see  the menu and said we'd be back for dinner.  It was obvious he had no interest in making us feel welcome.  Apparently he's busy enough and doesn't  need  any new customers.  I understand restaurants totally.  My family's business in Fla. was restaurants.  Successful because we served good food and service but always welcomed guests and made them feel special.  Most Italians myself included are warm and inviting  Thanks for letting me share.  Very disheartening

dNQMFPywquABqGPrwQ_qMA.text: My favorite place to be on Friday nights.  There eggplant Parmesan, pasta Alex and homemade gnocchi is incredible.   BYOB and cash only.

BcO70eYGsIWWBkHubNVToA.text: Really good food! Great service really fun owner! They serve the best Arnold Palmer I never had.

pmfR0lMgEouNOIx3pO5xrg.text: OMG! If you want the best Italian meal in Scottsdale you must try Ristorante Giuseppe's.  Came here for my husband's Birthday and we had the best dinner here.  I had Eggplant Rollatini, he had the special of the day Cioppino. The waitress Alexis is the best. You must come and try their delicious food.  I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zchK56UMZGblsEqj3xcOvw.text: The best service and Italian food. If you have a sense of humor, you must go. Bring your bottle of wine and enjoy!!

aeIdviePq8CHFF6sK6mQFg.text: Great dining experience.  Came here with my friends during the week and had a wonderful dinner!  Our service was excellent, the staff was super friendly and the food was fantastic!! Zero complaints!!!    Our food came out super fast.  I ordered a salad and the pasta special and both were great!  Prices are good but they only take cash.  Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RDgii25KuFh3bz0Q60IU5A.text: This is my favorite Italian food in Scottsdale!! It's very small because it is a family run restaurant. Most customers are repeat guests. They make you feel like family. It's almost like a hidden treasure. I recommend the pasta Alex, it's one of their specialties( a little spicy though ). Best dish in my opinion! The eggplant parmigiana is also a good option. I just love love love this place. Don't forget to bring cash!!!

d_5ChgPFDGG3xViKjN5v3Q.text: A large group of us went to this little restaurant for our last meet for an Italian class.  Never knew that this place existed and now I am glad I know it does :) We got to try three different dishes and they were really yummy!  The service was a bit slow (perhaps because of our large party), but friendly nonetheless. They do not accept cards as payment, so make sure you bring cash.  While the place was clean, it is noisy, but we dealt with it, being that it was a large party.  We definitely want to try it again (specially their ravioli -it was scrumptious, to say the least) and maybe try a whole bunch of dishes, since we got to try some of their plates.  Besides, I love Italian food, specially is it is as fresh as this place makes it!

EwT4xjKDXjMSzh-7bLRVtg.text: Not so impressed anymore. Portions have shrunk on main dishes, now a corkage fee. I can deal with those things but when they don't itemize the items you ordered on the bill nor put prices next to them, its just plain rude. All I got was a bunch of chicken scratch and a big number circled at the bottom. It makes you feel like they just looked at you and made up a price. Sorry Giuseppe, it was fun while it lasted.

cDWdTvI35yjh1D0AyLxPTw.text: BYOB without a corkage fee, this little strip mall restaurant is exceptional. Prices very reasonable, food was at the top of the list of local Italian restaurants. Look and feel of a neighborhood place from Chicago.....something I miss since moving here 25 years ago. Owner very friendly, accessible and he runs an establishment that we will be returning to again soon.

3KZTC1BfyiXFN-JadU1Hig.text: Excellent a + fresh great authentic.  Great food great price great owner . Business traveler and very particular on meat balls .  The best hands down ever . Gravy awesome !  Great value

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meatballs excellent

113pceTtKMgDA8YfWC2YLQ.text: Been treated rudely by the owner our two visits to this restaurant.  First time told there is one table available outside, but better finish in 45 minutes because someone else is coming to sit there.  But reservations are not taken?? When we asked for wine list and told it was BYOB, we left.  Thought we would try again.  Noticed it said no credit card accepted.  When asked if debit card works, said cash only.  When I said this should be posted somewhere instead of on the bottom of the menu, told has been in business 30 years and always this way.  Said very rudely.  I inquired of the waiter if that was the owner, and he said it was.  Which blows my mind that someone who owns a place would talk like this to a first time customer. We will find somewhere else to go.  Not sure why so many return to the place.  Except that you get a hug and kiss at the door.

tKjM_LakOn3mv1yH4sgUHw.text: Love it! Small and family room. Great food and bring  your own wine (no corkage fee). Love the Pasta Alex! We almost always opt for the specials. We have opted to eat family style as times as well.   Highly recommend and will return.  N*joy!

H1YGQXERqYHerlvA99qRRw.text: Best Italian food in the area. Amazing flavors, great sauce work. It's a small place and can get packed but well worth it. Been going here 10+ years. Really top notch Italian for the valley.

eoZJP-vzzL7yhxplKxAp3g.text: Had dinner there last night. Spaghetti was tasty. Friendly but slow service. Will give them another try next time I'm in Scottsdale.

8M5KCLBa-Wr8CufHOTxfnQ.text: My new favorite Italian joint. Great host, spoke Italian to my grandmother, and made us feel very welcome. It's a small intimate environment. The food was 10/10. I had the pasta Alex and it was lovely. I tried the lobster ravioli and it was great as well. Good bruschetta, tiramisu, cappuccinos, etc.   Make sure to bring cash! No cards accepted.

q1MplXV2Z8uupwOnFFH-PA.text: We were visiting Scottsdale area and friends recommended this place!! We sat outside. Giuseppe greeted us and was so friendly. Our waiter Alessandro was great, told us the specials and service was terrific!! We had spaghetti, chicken parmigiana and ravioli. All were great!!! We even splurged on desserts with choc gelato and tiramisu, so yummy!! Highly recommend this place!! Wish we lived closer!!!

52XulO3t3hN1uhEYOiYVkw.text: Ok, I was actually excited to try this place after reading the reviews. Most were good but there were some dicey reviews. So I needed to make up my own mind.  My daughter and I were going to a movie so we stopped in for a quick bite on a Wednesday night about 7. It's a cute place and the owner greeted us st the door. Seemed like a nice Italian guy. We sat right down and the waitress came over promptly. I kinda wanted an eggplant parmigiana  sandwich but, she told me they only do sandwiches for lunch. (That was kind of off for me). The menu is somewhat limited but that's ok too. I had a small house salad that was fresh and nice ( a little heavy on the oil in the dressing but nice). They brought over some bread and herb butter but the bread was phx yuck bread. I was hoping for some good crusty homemade bread. Don't get me wrong Giuseppe's is a very reasonably priced place, especially for Scottsdale so, I don't want to be over critical. My daughter ordered cheese raviolis and I ordered capellini marinara with a meatball. Mine was a tad salty but the meatball was fresh, lite and tasty. My capellini was a little mushy but fine. The marinara was rustic and flavorful - it was chunky not watery at all. Just a little salty.  The raviolis were good but not homemade. They were fine and both were good size portions.  I love that you can bring your own bottle. Phoenix needs more of these places.  Even though the menu says there's no corkage fee I believe there is a $5 fee now but that's still reasonable. The owner stopped by twice to ask how we were doing and how everything was. The food came out hot and promptly.  We had to leave for our movie so we didn't have any dessert or coffee so I cannot comment.  Overall we had an enjoyable dinner and was very comfortable. It seats about 40 inside and maybe another 20 outside - weather permitting. So on a busier night service maybe a little more challenging. I would like to go back with another couple and bring a couple bottles of wine. I give Giuseppe's  out of five. But look forward to going back again.   Ciao' Giuseppe !

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zTdQ5cqipuvTnI0zGy6lTQ.text: We just love this place! The food is unbelievable (you will never leave hungry) and they treat you like family. We moved to the area one year ago and a friend took my husband here. He immediately took our family. It is very small and they only take reservations for 6 people or more, so go early if you want to avoid the wait (there is no waiting area). It all adds to the experience! This has become our favorite place to eat in Scottsdale and we go to celebrate our family events (as we just did last night). Be sure to bring your cash (no credit cards accepted) and your favorite bottle of wine (they don't serve alcohol). Giuseppe's is the best!

9_irWT5HwMWZEXfinfb3Ew.text: First time visited due to reviews.  Can not say it lived up to the reviews as have had equal if not better quality Italian at other, better priced family restaurants locally.  The pasta in the mostiaccoli was slightly under cooked. The cannoli should not be crunchy like they're totally hard.  This was totally hard.  It should be both crisp and crumbly at the same time. Never hard like an ice cream cone... didn't taste right at all, in fact it tasted old.  The tiramasu was good.

anULFWkqWL9tytZ4K5_e6w.text: We have been coming here for years.  We love how they treat you like family.  After many many visits, Pasta Alex is the dish to have!  A little on the spicy side but worth it.  Make sure to bring your bottle of wine with you.  We come back almost every trip to Scottsdale.

P_kp-X-6LLZFhMhDyl5neA.text: After a horrid experience the night before at the local ABC (fake Italian restaurant), Giuseppe's restaurant was an enjoyable contrast which left me giddy.  I ordered Eggplant Rollatini with garlic bread and fresh made pasta with the ribs parmigiana and it was perfect!  My date enjoyed the Cioppino with mixed seafood. Everything was exceptionally fresh and well seasoned and in very large portions.  The Tiramisu was heavenly. Yum!  I will return to Giuseppe next time I'm in town.  I hope that other restaurant owners in the area will sample this menu and use it as an example of proper food and service.   B+

wOTlgvb23qS1OiNXlOSOYw.text: The best food and the BEST service. This place rocks. Such a local-feel and a genuine Italian restaurant (yes, they even all have accents). You have to get the "Pasta Alex" - it's the best thing on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

59FPbEqGn4vY2qqo1tOHhA.text: Awesome experience..BYOB is awesome. Food is great. Talking about building a personal connection with customer, this place is the best.

bhGsnhvRS_vgf3heNcMoaA.text: I went to Giuseppe's because a Co-Worker recommended this place for Valentine's day this year. I love Italian food and I enjoy trying new spots. Giuseppe's was awesome. We were able to set up a reservation on valentine's day (that was awesome) When my wife and I got there, we had to wait about 45mins. That was the only thing I could say that sucked. The atmosphere was great so we didn't get too upset about the wait. The owner was super nice to my family and he's son took my kid around with him to keep him entertained. They had a fixed menu of 4-5 items only that night. I ordered the Pasta Alex and my wife had their seafood plate. The pasta Alex was amazing! I couldn't have asked for a better pasta dish. We stayed until they closed. You do have to remember that this place is "CASH ONLY" but that was okay because I happen to have cash on me that night. I highly recommend this place to everyone that likes great Italian food and a great atmosphere. If you are very impatient, I don't recommend this place. They can take a while because they are "that" busy. My wife and I have been there 2 times since and we love this place.  FYI, This place is BYOB with no corking fee. ENJOY!

e40XZy2BEihQKF2QBz0bCA.text: Been to this place four or five times and it always is a solid choice for a quick cheap dinner out. I love the fact that you can bring your own bottle of wine or beer!  The food is always good but not Great......service is very attentive and polite. On Saturday night we had the Chicken Parm and Lasagna. Served hot and quick and we totally enjoyed the dinning experience. We walked out full and plopped down $32 for the meal. My only complaint is they don't itemize the bill so you don't know how to check your order against anything.  We will keep coming back for more though.....my wife's favorite on Italian night!

r0YLVWtNi3mE8Ip6dvfRvg.text: Dined at Guiseppes Saturday April 30.  Very crowded.  I ordered eggplant parmigiana, which arrived only lukewarm.  Cheese on top was coagulated and gummy.  The eggplant was drowned in breadcrumbs.  In fact, the eggplant and the breadcrumbs had become one soggy entity. Could not even find the eggplant.  Seemed it was sitting on a shelf in the kitchen waiting for some unsuspecting diner to order it. It was NOT freshly made, that's for sure. My husband ordered spaghetti putanesca with angel hair pasta.  Arrived with fettucine pasta and only three olives. The other two friends with us ordered seafood dishes with garlic and butter sauce and they loved their meals. We did not say anything because we did not want to put a damper on the evening.  Perhaps the place loses quality control when it is crowded.  Service was excellent and the owner is very friendly.

i0aqo2RtIKptLQyYtV9Gpg.text: What can I say except for this is Italian food done right! This little strip mall restaurant is truly a hidden gem for authentic Italian food lovers. It is a small family owned restaurant and you can always count on seeing the restaurant's owner Pasquale greeting customers and stopping by to see how everything is tasting. A few of our favorite dishes include the Meat Lasagna with meat sauce, the Peppino Special (baked ziti with chicken, veal, sausage) and the classic spaghetti with Meatballs. An additional perk is the option to bring your own wine without the corking fee. This is a small restaurant which seats maybe 50 people total and is a nice family casual atmosphere. Bring cash though as this restaurant does not accept credit/debit.

lwudOqXpLCiEljuRgi5iZA.text: I don't know if you can get better Italian food around this area.     I always order the Pasta Alex and Giuseppe's Salad, but there isn't anything on the menu that I've tried that isn't great.  (And the specials are always worth trying as well.)  I am pretty sure that everyone that works here is family, or practically family, so the atmosphere is always fun and laid back.    You should be prepared to wait if you come at peak time.   This is a very popular local spot.  You'll see families that range from newborns to grandparents, as well as plenty of couples on a date night.  Also, good news is that you can byob.  Bad news is it is cash only, so you may have to run to the ATM.

aP1iKODUY7iRfSIpBp3TKQ.text: Awesome food especially if you like Neapolitan sauce. & the owner gives you personal table side service.. Bring your own wine if you want any:)

y8DkkJfPLQQYEeWZAmKM1g.text: Great food and excellent service. Home made desserts. Owner is on hand to stop and talk. Can't believe I stumbled upon this gem of a restaurant.

TF6QHcMrh1IVxkWLbRKz9A.text: Traditional 70's style Italian-American food in a strip mall mainly notable because you can bring your own wine with no corkage fee.  Don't believe the hype - this place is nothing special.  Contrary to the many reviews here that comment on how cheap it is, I found it a bit expensive for what you're getting, which is not exactly nuova cucina.  $15.95 for two small (non-homemade) cannelloni a la carte is not a bargain in my book.  Their linguine with white clam sauce is some canned clams tossed with a copious amount of oil (1/2 a cup perhaps) and some boxed pasta for $12.95.  The $9.95 "insalata Romana" is a plate of tired iceberg lettuce, a tomato wedge or two, and a few shreds of bland cheese swimming in a very tart vinaigrette.     This is the kind of food that used to represent Italian food in America before the food revolution of the 80's.  The kind of place you'd find, not in New York or Chicago, but in Terre Haute or Tampa at a time when "eye-talian" food was still considered a bit exotic.  The many reviews stating that this is "real homemade Italian food" are a bit puzzling since it's neither homemade nor Italian.  This is very old-fashioned pre-foodie Italian-American food and while it's OK for what it is, it certainly isn't "real Italian" food by any stretch of the imagination nor is it, for the most part, homemade.    N.B. No, a visit to this restaurant is not "just like going to Italy."  For that matter, it's not just like going to Little Italy.  I realize Phoenix is not exactly a mecca for italian food, but WTF people!      The mostly 60+ crowd seems to love it.  I can only guess that they are overwhelmed by nostalgia for a simpler time, because while it may not be Kierland pretentious nor a crappy chain restaurant, the food just isn't very good.  Seriously.   The servers have a strange attitude that I guess is supposed to be "east-coast" or something (rushed, cocky, borderline rude) but seems a bit out of place in what is basically a mom and pop strip mall joint serving canned food with plastic red checked tablecloths and thin paper napkins.  In any case, they are very selective with their attention and you can wait quite a while to get something.  Also, as several other reviewers have pointed out, they give you a non-itemized bill with just the total due written on it which seems to include an extra 10% or so with no explanation offered.   This seems quite bizarre to me but apparently no one objects.  At this restaurant, $15.95 + $12.95 + $9.95 somehow add up to $45.65.  The non-itemized bill is a weird affectation at best - why would you do that, especially in a cheap joint like this?  But to do that and then mis-calculate?  There's a word for that in Italian - it's imbrogliare.   $54 for two with tip for a simple shared salad and two pasta dishes with no meat and no drinks.

bXkBuaPzS1yFYDmWWJIq0A.text: Anybody who has rated this place below 5 stars is either a complete idiot or a liar. This is a great family/date atmosphere. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for great authentic Italian food.

UYxJgiUN1GI_xnFYSGYSHA.text: One of the few places in Arizona that I will give 5 stars to. Amazing family run Italian restaurant. You'd think you were in Italy.

NC3oxXJyACqSeES_2oO_rg.text: No reservations needed for Friday night. Went around 7pm. Got a table right away. Was in and out in an hour. So friendly I felt like I knew them forever after leaving. Can't wait to try more dishes from here. Everything tasted fresh.

Zg05xVGMD9CzbB--rTlVoA.text: Quirky! Quirky! This is your kind of place IF -- don't use a credit card, don't want alcohol and don't expect a written check at the end of the meal. HOWEVER, if you want good Italian food and very reasonable prices, step right in! Went with the "Out to Lunch Bunch" yesterday and it was quite the experience. The owner was everywhere. He took the orders, delivered the food and picked up the cash. He reminded me of the "Soup Nazi" from Seinfeld. One of the group asks for more of the wonderful marinara sauce. the "Soup Nazi" says "No." Another one says her pasta is cold. He says "you ate most of it and now you say its cold." Of course he was kidding. The one got her sauce and other got her pasta heated. Too funny! When the time came for the separate checks, the owner asked each person what he/she had and announced an amount. That was it! No written check. To one of the group he said "Give me $11 and I'll be happy."  Unusual to say the least. I would say the ambiance is "early family." I liked it -- pictures of family and friends adorned the walls and under the glass on the tables. I found it endearing. So even though the place is not what you expect of a restaurant today, the food is good, the price is right and the staff and owner are friendly and accommodating, I'll be back.

MpHNTONFTOBlJADUb7CIbw.text: The staff is amazing. Made me feel as if I was actually in Italy. Homemade everything. But they only take cash fyi made that mistake. I ordered the stuffed shells and garlic bread and just about went to heaven. Soooo good.

G32QYRdCXsXkzYc7OpMcKA.text: This place is awesome.  Great food, super friendly staff.  Really has a nice warm family feel.  Our daughter has so much fun.  Every time someone who worked here walked by, they would flirt and play with her and she loved the attention.   Awesome place for families to eat in a nice, warm atmosphere.  Highly recommend.

9bPbk9rFVE7VIHi3L-3n6w.text: The food is absolutely wonderful, service is quick and friendly.  I felt like family and will go back.  They have many traditional specialties on the menu but also have daily and unique specials.  The Eggplant Rolotini and the Pork Cacciatore are amazing.  Franco makes our visits special.

iEoQWMFUF9kXtTMvCWqWbw.text: Not worth the wait. From the reviews I was expecting more.  Pasta over cooked not much sauce and really just not worth it.....sorry!

_MpmdT3P7xSsvlk6NM2Q_g.text: Awesome food! Prices were terrific and you can bring your own wine or beer. I love this place!

sE59f-tpN-5_Qldy9NkELA.text: the people and food were wonderful here.  you can't beat BYOB and great food.  food reasonably priced, is cash only.  we took friends that were from out of town and everyone loved it.

uypO4hLCx0dYuJ8eWTxEMQ.text: I was super excited to try this place out, but the no corkage fee was the only A+ plus for me.  We started with the bruschetta.  For $10.95 we got the fresh tomato and basil special .  4 large toasts, not a lot for the price.  More topppings and a lot larger at Postino for 2 bucks more.  I stayed optimistic though.  My side salad came, good price of $2.95.  Ice berg lettuce with one olive and a tomato.  I guess this is all you can expect.  Then the main courses.  We had a variety eggplant, pork, lasagna, Alex special, 3 @ $15.95.  The portions were very small.  I'm in agreement with the below, they are European portions, and almost filling, but not for $15.95!  I hate to say it, but I would rather head to Carabba's and get 3 times as much food for the same price.  And I'm not even a chain person.  I just finished ice cream at home and my fiance is chowing down on chips.  Not what I expected!

_TgJLz-gwtqEGdGT0l4ZPQ.text: Wow! Right next to my hotel in Scottsdale. This place only has maybe 10 tables inside with some outside seating. The waiter recommended the Pasta Giuseppe. He was right! Penne pasta with I think is a vodka sauce with meat and sausage. I've never tasted sauce like this! It was awesome! A little spicy so I didn't need to add crushed pepper. I just added a little parmesan out of habit but it didn't need it. The sauce was not red. It was orange with small size pieces of meat. I wish I could eat it all! Yum! :-)         As MacArthur said, "I'll be back"
