1EO-csk5DCPbx-E77h9Lcg.text: Cons:  Hot inside Loud inside, small place Owner sitting with patrons next to our table drinking and loudly cursing. MAJOR TURN OFF / NOT A GREAT 1st IMPRESSION. Especially with our young daughter sitting at the table.  Linguini with clams- not fresh, out of a can, sauce was heavy on the oily side. Cash only, no itemize receipt- no tax shown on bill. $80 bucks - nothing special   Pros:  Me not spending any more money here.

BNd57ZI1NVlw3eNAe0L2cA.text: We arrived for an early weeknight dinner and the restaurant was pretty empty. Despite that fact, the service was slow. We brought a bottle of wine because we'd read about the BYOB policy. The waiter informed us that there would be a $5. charge to use their wine glasses which was surprising. We ordered Veal Parmesan and linguine with clam sauce. We also ordered dinner salads, which were a separate charge. Unfortunately the salad was basically plates of iceberg lettuce drowning in Italian dressing. The entrees were good. All in all it was decent, but I'm not in a hurry to go back.

TXtLzNiSJIznql3hs572FA.text: Superb Cioppino, and Chicken Parmesan. Delightful, welcoming Owner who still loves his labors here. Can't wait to come back!

dy2_Mk4YxrsPfJpwsYYDPg.text: We have lived by here for a long time, but never stopped in.  For a birthday celebration, we decided to give it a try.  The best part is that it is an independent restaurant - not a chain.  We loved that we could bring our own wine.  The cash only is a little tough, but with pre-planning it is fine.    The eggplant appetizer was out of this world.  Everyone's dinner was spectacular - I had the ravioli.  And we loved the flourless chocolate dessert.    You want to go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wow

7H8kf5BrQ9JHFzTJVlxp6g.text: This is old school Italian and pretty good eats. Nice variety and a fair price point. Service is informal but effective. Its about the food, isn't it. The ambiance is neighborhood "Jersey ". No liquor or wine served so BYO. There is a good chance that you will be schmoozed by "Giuseppe " himself.

HvhCAmXeypdv0YaEbDJ3mQ.text: Good little place. It can get loud, people are there eating, visiting with other tables and generally having a good time! Cash only! even though there are signs everywhere, we somehow missed them.

ot3evVMyagM9I3NR9Z9XTg.text: Some of the best Italian food I've ever had!  Great little spot, great service and an overall great experience.  We will be back many times to try everything.

0uEBimqAx2QBrar3fqXm7w.text: Heard about this place a while back.  I like the fact that it's family owned and not a chain.  They only take cash, which fine.  The ambiance is a small hole in the wall place, with laid back, casual setting, nothing too fancy.  The food looks all freshly made.  However, ordered the daily special recommended by the owner.   The daily special was 4 large ravioli on a plate (two stuffed with cheese and other two stuffed with meat).  It wasn't expensive, I think around 7-8 dollars, but that portion is more like an appetizer, it wouldn't fill anyone up.  So portion size is the only reason that I can't give it 5 stars.  Looking forward to going there again in the near future and ordering off the menu.

k3OcnkRenjrkuSq8x9W-oQ.text: When I hear the name Giuseppe I picture a little old man in the kitchen making spaghetti and meatballs like his grandmother used to make. So I was surprised when I found out that there isn't anyone named Giuseppe working in the back, though this wasn't the only surprise of the evening. The other little curve ball was a little embarrassing, we were scrambling to scrape together enough money to pay the bill, Ristorante Giuseppe only takes cash. However, this little stumble did not interfere with the food nor the fantastic service and hospitality we received.   Ristorante Giuseppe is what a mom and pop independent restaurant is all about. The charismatic father runs the front of the house, the sons are the servers and mom makes all of the desserts. The father Pasquale interacts with everyone, he's so warm and welcoming it was like going to a friends home for dinner. While they do not serve liquor, you're more than welcome to bring your own beer and wine to accompany your dinner and no corkage fee, unbelievable.   The menu is filled with classic Italian-American dishes and as well as assorted daily specials. Our server was telling us about the specials and noticed that his eyes were steel blue. I'm not sure how long he was talking to us but as soon as he walked away my trance was broken; I have no idea what he said. I can be such a dork.  Once you place your order you're brought out a basket of warm bread with garlic butter, I love little touches like this. Just be careful not to fill up on the fluffy bread, there's so much in store starting with the deliciously simple Eggplant Rollatini ($9.75). Slices of eggplant are lined with cheese, covered in bread crumbs and pan fried, then the roll ups are covered with tomato sauce and cheese. Or if you loved stewed peppers and onions try the Peperonata ($6.95), a great combination of sweet, savory with just a hint of spice.   My dining companions filled me in on the nightly specials which ended up being a couple of pasta dishes. The first was the Peppino Special ($15.95), a mix of tube pasta, alfredo and tomato sauces with meatballs, chicken and sausage then covered with cheese and baked. Another was the big brother to the tortellini called Tortelloni ($15.95), a large ring shaped pasta, filled with meat then again covered in sauce, cheese and baked. Do you see the trend here? Baked pasta dishes are so hearty and satisfying; no wonder the other patrons looked so happy.   Along side we also had Sausages ($1.95) and Meatballs ($1.95) which were platted as a clever homage to the maleness of the restaurant, with just a little bit of cream sauce on the tip of each sausage, well you get the idea.   Desserts were as comforting and homey like the creamy smooth Cheesecake ($3.95) which ended up being one of the best slices of cheesecake I've had in a very long time. Not being a fan of Cannoli ($3.95) Id have to say that they turned me into a believer. Its ricotta filling was so light and airy with just the right amount of chocolate chips and a pastry shell that was crisp without a trace of greasiness.   Genuine and honest, Ristorante Giuseppe is a neighborhood gem that I wish was in my neighborhood.

OBkcVWd6SgbTd6bW56_M9g.text: I can't give this place enough 5 stars. Wish there were more. We have eaten here repeatedly and had nothing but exceptional food and service.

m3bnPhILzpDRYbcZTjBZ7Q.text: don't expect white tablecloths and fancy flatware. There's places to go if you want that.  If you want good, honest, amazing food, with a casual atmosphere, this place is it. The sauces are fantastic. Try the bolognese. Try the lasagne. Try the meatballs. Everything tastes like it's made from scratch and with love.

wGyTOwP7SRQSbWs8pwDqDg.text: PASTA ALEX!!!!! I crave Pasta Alex!! This is a unique family dining experience! It's packed with fun, it's loud & it's perfectly crazy! By the time you leave you will feel like you are 100% part of their Italian family! It has been there forever & feels like it, but somehow that adds to its character!! Its packed with fun and flavor! It's the locals best kept secret!!  We Love this place for family birthday parties!

_trC6JNcJ4TD52xIHP4lvw.text: Ehhhhhh is about all I can say.  My ravioli tasted like they were out of a can with some decent sauce and garlic chunks poured over.  Spaghetti tasted bland and the meatballs were not good at all.  The baked ziti I guess was ok from the others in the party but we came to the conclusion that we will not return.  Service was good, I can say that but the food fell way short.  The other Italian place in the same little plaza on the corner is much better hence why we frequent it.  Having travelled thru Italy many times this place is nowhere near as authentic as they and others claim to be.

XHtTpXZrgqIz9yZ6_-Wl1w.text: I love this place. I LOVE it. It does something so many other restaurants try but fall short of doing: Ristaurante Guissepe makes you feel like you're home, part of the family.  The moment you walk in to this little restaurant you meet Pascal and his staff/family. They usher you to your table, open your bottle, and offer you an appetizer. Meanwhile, Pascal moves from table to table, warmly greeting everyone as a friend, laughing with them and making each guest feel as though they belong. The wine flows as food makes it to each of the red checkered tables adorned with campy pictures of family events. And the food...I have been tempted many times by their various specials, but I keep coming back for Pasta Alex. Delicious, perfectly prepared pasta, cheese, and spicy sausage...incredible.  Remember to bring cash and a bottle of wine, then sit back enjoy the atmosphere.

rDExeM2ei5rPCYr0yLZb6Q.text: Delicious food. Staff is confident in the cuisine and the low key setting shows that it's the food not the bells and whistles of a fancy restaurant that have people returning. CASH ONLY however so be prepared. We went last minute with a large group and fortunately they were able to accommodate even though we took up half of the small restaurant. Great find and we will definitely return. We all got different dishes and nobody was disappointed. Perfect for a date night but ok for kids since kids love pasta!! Would love to dine on the patio next time bc it seems so quaint.

jRCIBjVONIHv4YCbmsZhUw.text: what a throwback to the 80s but if you what food like Nonna made you as a kid this is the place nothing fancy just really grate food the service is genuine nothing fake not over friendly cash only OK bring your own wine or beer too

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggplant

kyO3JrUNwWUX-KYFAtRtKw.text: Picture a small family kitchen in Old Italy and classic meals with their own secret ingredients and you'll have the menu at Giuseppe's.   This place was a suggestion from a new client when we were in his neck of the woods. We are starving after meeting and brainstorming lunch ideas when he mentioned this little Italian restaurant. My boss's eyes lit up and it was decided. I ordered stuffed peppers for lunch and it was deliciso. Lunch came with a side of Italian bread and homemade butter.   If you love Italian food, put Giuseppe's Ristorante on your must-try list!

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Stuffed pepper

gC7OSBgSo5ehOVMZ0rS5uA.text: Upon entering what i can only perceive as HEAVEN, my boyfriend and i were sat down right away. We were promptly offered beverages, he had a water and I had magic in a cup or as they call it "Ice Tea". upon looking over the menu, we both saw the perfect items. We shared bruschetta before eating dinner. My boyfriend had the Chicken Parm and I had the Alessandro's Special. I thought i died and was being greeted by God at the pearly gates when i bit into my dinner. The lemon sauce flowed perfectly over my chicken and into my mouth. My taste buds danced in rejoice. after finishing my dinner, we got dessert. A cannoli? Tiramisu? why not both? exactly what i was thinking. The desserts were a perfect ending to a wonderful dinner. upon leaving the restaurant we were reminded that we were in the real world. this was easily the best Italian food we have ever had, hands down. The owner was also seen cleaning tables and greeting customers while inside the restaurant. he is a very wonderful man. remember to bring cash...

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not on the menu, but ask for bruschetta! It was delicious!
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Parmigiana on top and Lemon Chicken on the bottom. I highly recommend the Lemon Chicken.
Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli and THE BEST tiramisu I have ever had.

djnQ5CQOMgVTZXZSYu-qpA.text: Amazing!! The best Italian I've found in the area. Everything is fresh and delicious. The restaurant is family owned and the service is great and genuine. You can also BYOB! Just don't forget cash as credit is not accepted.

Ue7lDdDArXbr2Phn4CjVvw.text: Tucked in an unassuming strip mall, this was a great find on our recent Scottsdale visit. Prices are in line and food quality was very good. Dependent on your approach, the ambience is authentic Italian...and fun. If looking for fancy trappings - go elsewhere. Interesting for us was the "Bring your own wine in" as they don't sell it. They will open and pour for you happily. This is a nice add-on as you save on industry-standard inflationary wine prices. In short - it comes down to expectations. We were looking for a nice, warm, friendly, personalized dining experience with good food. Mission accomplished!

mL_wHPRTNKuqIt1HAFnrjA.text: This is easily my favorite Italian restaurant- dining there is like being at your best friend's house.   First- it's important to note it is cash only.  Just hit an ATM and grab some cash. You won't need much- the prices are very very reasonable.   The food here is great! Hearty, tasty- and packed with flavor. My favorite thing to get is the eggplant parm appetizer. It's so damn good.   You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, and keep your eyes out for the special "Pasta Alex" it's so tasty.   Save room for dessert- the cheesecake and cannoli are freshly made by the owners (Pasquale) wife.   This awesome restaurant is BYOB, so feel free to grab some beer or wine and pair with your meal.   Last but not least- they do catering and it is tremendous. They catered several family events and as usual- the food and price point cannot be beat.   Enjoy your meal and say hi to Pasquale for me.

vtlkDERyqpXWdVHKzTIOng.text: Let me begin by saying the food here is very well prepared, fresh and good quality. The ambiance is definitely family friendly. The restaurant appears clean and wait staff Professional. The lasagna may be the best we've had. The restaurant does not sell alcoholic beverages, but supports a BYOB policy. Now for the bad news. As previously stated by a couple of other reviews, the restaurant is a cash only business. I get that....It's a business decision. However what troubles me is the bill is not itemized. As we did the math, our bill appeared to be approximately $10-$15.00 more then we calculated based on the prices printed on the menu. We have traveled around the world and have never seen a bill in a restaurant that only reflects a "total". Is this legal in Arizona?  Based on other reviews, people have been publicly humiliated for questioning their bill, so I decided to let it slide. However, I felt ripped off and in spite of the good food will probably not go back. This is Scottsdale and there are so many equally good restaurants to choose from. I would like to know if this "total bill" practice is legal, so I will check with a couple of my legal eagle friends for future reference.

2zb2sMQSBnyS4vF6oILk-Q.text: This review should read more like a 3.5 stars.  My wife and I ventured out here last night on a whim.  We were happily surprised when we didn't need to pay a corkage fee!  It is always great to bring a nice bottle of wine from home and refrain from paying the ridiculous markup that some restaurants charge.  Soo.... you're saying I can pay $50 for a bottle of wine I can get at the supermarket for $16.   The service is poor to average.  Our server was attentive, but seemed bored when he was talking care of us.  He didn't really want to explain the menu to us and was hurried.  The ambiance isn't great.  It's very family friendly but it's definitely a hole in the wall.  The owner is sweet and he makes the rounds to every table hob nobbing with the regulars and greeting the newbies.   The food itself is the star here which it should always be.  We got the spaghetti with meat sauce and the chicken parmigiana.  The spaghetti was cooked well, and was delicious.  The chicken parmigiana was pretty good, although there were parts that were a bit stringy.  The desert was the best part.  Home made and yummy.  The cannoli was good and reminded me of some of the best cannolis I've had in New York, and the tiramisu while not the most stylish of presentations was yummy.   That tiramisu is probably the best representation of the place as a whole.  Not really appealing to look at but filled with soul.  Also it cost $55 to eat for 2 people with apps, entrees, and desserts.  So that rocks.  They only take cash so be warned, Amex will not save you.

ZnhTrPrfj7s3ID7h6pc1lw.text: My family has been coming here for at least fifteen years. Not sure why I am just now writing a review, but better late than never! This little family owned and operated Italian place has always, and will always, be amazing. The service, the food, the atmosphere, everything about this place is as good as it gets.   At least one or more of the family members are working every night, and they take great pride in what they produce. There are family photos all around, as well as on the tables. The 3 boys all work in the restaurant when they are available or in town, and even if you don't get served by one of them, the service is always amazing.   They have specials every night which I love, because I am still able to try new things even though I have been coming here for years. My favorite's are always their ravioli and their Giuseppe's salad. Some of their menu items are named after each of the sons, which is a really nice gesture.   They also allow you to bring your own wine, and no corking fee! Such a great part, and it makes the bill a little lower than if you were to go elsewhere.   We will go to this place as long as it is around. We go here as soon as one of our friends comes into town for the first time, and they always request to go back when they come back into town. Even though we live in Cave Creek, we make the trip to this little restaurant. Great place for family, food, and a whole lotta love!

photos.caption: Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Back corner with their t shirts hanging proudly

jbRfG_lWOcPeRdhEumP4Vw.text: Came here for lunch today after a massage in the same shopping mall. Excellent food at a great price, portions are perfect as well. The owner was serving everyone and seemed to have many regulars in which he knew personally. It has a feel like home when you walk in. The baked ziti was delicious as well as the meatballs. Will definitely be back! Make sure you bring cash as they don't take cards. :)

Bz9TYc3EXwrX7uK9mPasow.text: If I could give this restaurant 10 stars I would definitely do so. They have the most AMAZING linguini Alfredo pasta EVER! I asked them if they could substitute linguini to a really thin pasta and add mushrooms to it and they were happy to grant my request! My son LOVES their lasagna and their garlic bread. The only downside of this place (but doesn't apply to me because I always carry cash) is that they don't take cards, so bring cash! Friendly staff and comfortable ambiance. We live in California and visit Scottsdale every 6 weeks and we eat there EVERY time we are in town.

Photo of Ristorante Giuseppe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tastes heavenly!

ncibTboGTodwRP6ZV_EXBw.text: I recently move to Scottsdale and my son in law help get my stuff into the new place. So to show my gratitude I took my Daughter and son in law to dinner. A person I met at lifetime fitness told me about this place. On Sunday the 29th of January 2016 we tried this ristorante. The staff was very friendly and the owner was warm and welcoming. The food was great and being a wine collector, having the opportunity to bring in your own was was great. I would highly recommend this place to wine collectors and people that like family style italian. Dale Johnson

OC69NRDCK42EuAQJ0eF3hg.text: Well if had a choice of ZERO stars I would have done that for Giussepe's!  We have been going to Giuseppe's for many years & thought food was better than most and BYOB was great to bring in wine for us!  The billing has always been weird even for a small party of 2, but the last 2 times with large groups it has been a total mystery to figure out with no line items for food & just a total on bottom??  Plus cash only to pay really??? Not knowing the bill line items is not normal anymore anywhere!  I'm warning fellow yelper's too that we just had our final meal here with a group of 12 going out here for dinner, we ordered dinner family style with brushetta, an antipasta salad with literally no meat on it, a ravioli with mushrooms no meat, pasta Alex house favorite, & chicken piccata to get the final mysteriously excessively large bill $450.00. All the couples are trying to figure out how this could be so high in a restaurant with items priced on the menu than $8-16, with our bill at $37+ per person. Why would you again, hand us one piece of paper with a number on it with nothing else?? This would never fly for anyone in corporate america.  I agree with what Lee W. said! It's a sad day when a once great restaurant succumbs to such a ridiculous money grab from longtime customers!! UGH UGH

WcCBoC7acc1ybUrOxlATKQ.text: The best authentic Italian restaurant in Arizona, by far.   The bring your own wine aspect gives it even more charm.  Owner, Pasquale, who is there every night greeting newcomers and regulars alike, makes going to Giuseppe's even more special.  The food is outstanding.

OEQYJhYguwRck1XEfRxArw.text: Food is amazing! Cute little hole in the wall authentic Italian restaurant. It has a nostalgic New York vibe. Loved the ambiance. The staff is super friendly also. Absolutely will return!

yy1GU43hslwHDAhmHD0pfQ.text: Fantastic place, totally worth having to have cash (they don't take anything but cash). The food is amazing, and at least for lunch, is extremely affordable.

xKwC6H2tvEcV0kJkUJPiZg.text: We travel to Scottsdale on a regular basis and have eaten here in each visit. Every time we visit, we stop in after golf and make reservations there for the evening. During this visit, we tried to make reservations and were told just to come in and there would be no problem. We did that and were seated at the last table in the back which had extremely poor lighting. We asked about moving to another table and they were reluctant to move us - but they finally did a bit later. The "owner" and I believe it's the owner because he told us he's the one who puts the money in the bank. He told us he had been there 16 years and that they NEVER in those 16 years took reservations for 2 people. This is not True since I have personally made reservations for 2. The most disconcerting thing about our visit is how rude and nasty the owner was. This restaurant is now OFF our list.

xdn76cErlmkSnDazZyUy6w.text: I can't say enough about this place.  The service was fantastic and the food was authentic Italian cuisine.  Often people are accustomed to classical New York / Chicago Italian food.  This isn't what your looking for if that describes your favorite Italian food.     First of all the staff seemed to be mostly family.  Giuseppe walks around toasting patrons and mandating you put your phones away because he wants you to enjoy the time your having his his restaurant.  The BYOB policy is awesome and allows you to bring wine you know you'll enjoy without blowing the bank.    The menu is very classic but the specials rotate and were amazing. Based on the other reviewers you may want to ask what the price is before you order a special, but I don't recall having that problem without group and there were 6 of us.    Everyone in the party had appetizers, salad, entrees and we split 3 desserts.  The total was about $30 per person after the gratuity.  I see other reviews saying similar amounts were paid but I really didn't think it was a bad price to pay for a great evening out with friends.  Be sure you bring your cash, no cards at this joint!  Salute!!!

K1fKQIMbMjddEjDkW-7MMA.text: Best Italian food in Arizona!!  My cousin and I always have the best dishes as well as incredible service. We love it especially enjoy the Pasta Alex!

L3Q0UV2HOEMmUsF-hQ9Tjw.text: Great family dining in a quaint, homey setting!  Visiting family and am from Boston (so close to the Italian North End of Boston), my family brought me here. Just as good if not better!  Everything was delicious and the service was great.  The owner was personable and attentive!  Highly recommended!!

uSJq8fBUl0qVUkqz_VVtOw.text: The best hands down. Pasta Alex on point nothing else matters. I love this place and Pasquale is the best host. No corking fee, bring your wine and go tough in life. My favorite Italian spot in AZ.   I write more in my reviews but I don't need to on this spot. If you don't love it I will buy your meal. Amazing!!!  The best, the best, the best, the best The best, the best, the best, the best The best, the best, the best, the best The best, the best, the best, the best The best, the best, the best, the best The best, the best, the best, the best The best, the best, the best, the best The best, the best, the best, the best The best, the best, the best, the best

c8FcYBcgwwoOvTfB3WB8pg.text: I love Italian food, so finding good spots in the Scottsdale area is always on my list. After reading all the great reviews of Giuseppe's, we decided to try it out. We went on a Saturday night and luckily got there by 5:40, because by 6pm, the place was packed (even the outside tables). Having grown up in the Northeast, Giuseppe's definitely gave me the feel of Italian restaurants I grew up with. So with that, I give Giuseppe's an A for atmosphere.  The service was okay. It was polite, but a little slow and not much attention was paid during the meal. I'm used to servers checking at least once to see if we need something. That did not happen until after we were finished with our meals. The one thing I was very disappointed with was the lack of attention from the owner. I watched as he went around the restaurant talking to people and asking how their food was. Although we were pushed a little out of the way, he certainly could have stopped by our table as well, but never did. That did not go unnoticed. For service, I give them a C.  As for the food, I got the baked ziti with tomato sauce and my husband got the chicken parmesan. The food literally came out five minutes after we ordered, which was a bit odd, but overall it was good. I give the sauce a B+, but the food overall more like a B-. The baked ziti did not have ricotta in it, which typically it does. Basically it was a bowl of pasta with some mozzarella melted on top. My husband's response to "how is it?" about his meal was "it's ok."  At the end of the day, I'll give Giuseppe's another try, but I can't rave about it the way others have.

H_EY9y8v-ETEAOzv5RDqxA.text: This was our first time visiting Giuseppe's and consider the restaurant to be an outstanding place for Italian food. I'm Italian and was raised on high quality fresh/homemade Italian food. As always when evaluating a new Italian Restaurant, I order the spaghetti & meatballs to test: 1.freshness/quality/ratios of the ingredients coupled with how well cooked and seasoned. 2. presentation and temperature. 3. last but not least...over-all value. I have eaten spaghetti & meatballs all over the USA and Italy and must say the marinara sauce is some of the best I've ever tasted and the meatball IS the best I've ever tasted (better than my mom's). It's a casual atmosphere with a gregarious owner (Pasquale) who made us feel at home and was very attentive to our needs. The pasta was cooked perfectly, portion size was just right and the value of the meal was higher than the cost. By the way, it is cash only. No complaints...We will definitely be back and sample the other homemade dishes. Thank you Pasquale for providing our neighborhood with great Italian food...it is a find. Ray Fox

bq0uINHM5j6fd-8cjxwTAg.text: First time having dinner here although I have done take out sandwiches. Upon seating, I saw a woman eating a delicious looking pasta with red sauce and asked the server what it was.  It was Mostaccioli.  Yup, I wanted that.  Ordered a meatball on the side to find out what kind of meatballs they made.  Another person ordered linguini alfredo and hubby ordered his old stand by: eggplant and chicken combo which came with pasta on the side.  First they served some rustic italian bread that I liked but hubby thought was stale.  Not too stale though.  Good enough that two of us ate it without too much complaint.  It came with a garlicky herb butter that everybody liked.  Do you know that hunger makes stale bread go away?  The Mostaccioli came out looking amazing and if looking amazing was not enough, it tasted like it had been made by the Gods. It was cooked al dente perhaps more like al dentissimo, but really, really good.  The linguini alfredo was magnificent  (I was allowed to taste it only because everybody wanted to taste my amazing pasta!).  And then..... there is the story of the eggplant/chicken combo.  Firstly, the chicken was overcooked and then the most offensive of it all was that it had an over-refrigerated taste.  Have you ever kept something in the refrigerator so long that the flavors from the other foods permeated it?  Yup,  I tasted it and assured hubby that he was not going to get food poisoning that it was just a case of "we kept the chicken in the fridge too long." The overcooking, in my humble culinary opinion, is that the eggplant and the chicken are both pre-cooked and when an order comes in they put the sauce and cheese on it and then reheat it in a salamander or the oven. (IN MY HUMBLE OPINION).  So the mood was not so light at our table tonight.  You know that when the chief is not happy it is not a good thing.   But the chief was really nice about it and didn't say anything to the staff about the chicken.  Next scenario. I had my heart set on having some tiramisu so I called over the server and asked him about the tiramisu.  I was concerned about having old desserts served to me.  He went on and on about how the desserts are made by so-and so's wife and they are fresh, fresh, fresh,  etc etc etc.  As he went through his litany of desserts, he mentioned flourless chocolate cake which hubby loves.  I figured that I would make up for his bad meal by getting him the chocolate cake.  So I said, we'll have the tiramisu and the chocolate cake and almost in an arrogant, insulted fashion, he said: I'll continue telling you about the gelatos.  The fact that I already told him what I wanted was of no consequence.  He continued his litany of gelato flavors almost like Forrest Gump's buddy Bubba did as he called off the shrimp dishes from all corners of the earth.  I waited for his conclusion painfully, hoping he would turn around and get our desserts.  He did.  Finally.   Next scenario. He arrived with 3 dishes.  One with the flourless cake which was to brighten my "sunshine's" day and provide relief to the disappointment of his meal.  Another had all whipped cream in it which we were to share.  And the third dish was a "cannoli???"   Wait, wait........ wait.......  let me look more closely.....no,  it's not a small cannoli.  it's... it's.... OMG.... it's our tiramisu!!!! A tiramisu the size of a cannoli, I KID YOU NOT.  Too bad I didn't take a photo of it.  Two lady fingers (used to make tiramisu) was the extent of the tiramisu.  Never ever have we seen anything like this before.  Could have easily been one bite except I am too much of a lady to do that in a restaurant.  If I had been home with a tiramisu of that size, I would have bent my head backwards like a seal and scarfed down the entire piece in one bite.  And then to make it worse, hubby compared the flourless chocolate cake to others I have brought home for him and it did not meet his standard.  Bust #2. Score:  0-0 .  Next scenario. We get the bill and it is a slip of paper with a total amount due, non-itemized,  a few names of the dishes scribbled down but no prices-Just the total due.  Reminds me of the bills Tony Soprano used to get at his favorite haunt except that Tony didn't have to pay.  How do I know if my bill was correct?  I don't.  Do I have to sit there with a calculator??  Maybe.  And maybe someone else, not me.   Don't know what to say except that my pasta dish was amazing.  The question is whether all the other bad stuff that happened during this dinner can be made up by even the best of pastas.

Mvy-N8sUtYzFOaDshO52Ag.text: I don't think people who are regulars here know the difference between good italian food and bad italian food.   The service was good.  I would not say that it is very inexpensive.  The BYOB helps.  The food???? Lets put it this way.  We ordered the chicken piccata.  It was cold.  Working in many restaurants in the past I can tell you that the chicken piccata which should be made to order and is normally made with thin chicken breast medallions, was premade(possibly a day in advanced).  It was a large breaded chicken breast that was dropped in the fryer to order.  The outside was fried but inside the chicken was cold and dried out like it had been precooked and sitting in the cooler for some time.  Are you kidding me???  Really?  Pre-made.  Italian chefs I know would be rolling on the ground.   The pasta was ok at best.    Nothing to stand up and shout over.  I am glad I did not get sick.  I will never go back to that place.  I question the dining experiences of these past reviews but oh yeah that's right its Scottsdale.  The New Yorker's think this is good? You got to be kidding me.   Really?

JEAYxhVPCFzwbrgbkfdU0Q.text: What a great way to spend an evening. Good friends, Good wine (BYOB,W) and great food. Giuseppe is the key to the whole dining experience. He will personally make sure that you are enjoying yourself. Makes you feel like you've been part of the neighborhood for years. Doesn't charge a decorking fee but MAKE SURE you have enough wine for the boss. It's a small restaurant that adds to the cozy dining experience but the food is definitely big time. Bring an appetite. Portions are tasty and generous. My personal favorite is Pasta Alex. A little bit spicy. Just the way i like it. Everyone who visits me from back east gets to have dinner at Giuseppe's. Manhattans Little Italy and the Bronx Arthur Avenues would be proud of this place.

uteqSnvMA7e2iLYzJB_RIw.text: Mmmmm  mmmmm mmmmm.  OMG.  Where do I start? When I was little, we lived next door to an old Italian couple.  The wife would cook "gravy" every week and once in awhile she would invite us over to have some pasta and gravy.  Well, let just say, eating pasta at Giuseppe's was like visiting my childhood all over again.  I hadn't had gravy like this since I was a kid.  This place was so good that I went there two days in a row last week.  The menu is very simple and the pasta is cooked to al dente perfection.  On my first trip, I ordered chicken parm with a side of mostaciolli.    The second trip we tried the Pasta Alex which was very good and the Italian sausage.  They made up plates of spaghetti with butter and parm for the kids.  It is very kid friendly.  And on the way out, my kids were given complimentary Italian ices from the owner Pasquale.   Love this place!!!!  Oh, and it is BYOB!!!  :)

RL1lqNPoRQn-LxdoDLrVoA.text: Went there for the dinner. Food was tasty but way to expensive. For a dinner of garlic bread, and 2 supposedly $8 entrees, one with extra chicken, and one entree of  ravioli for 14, i got the cheque for $52 and when we requested for an itemized bill, the one that was supposed to be $8  they charged $18 for that just for adding chicken!!!!!! Dont think we will ever be going back there !!

8OFKGRbHG6TtIVMsjUI5WQ.text: Adorable Italian family making amazing Italian food.  The owner and his wife and sons are total sweethearts and produce some unsuspectingly great Italian food in a strip mall in North Scottsdale.

va9HOaLI7fPERl3YwtpSPg.text: We went here last night for my brothers b-day. We have heard great things about this place and were very excited. We get there and there was two cars in the parking lot. We almost left and went somewhere else just cause it was 6pm on a sat. night and  we were not sure about it. At the end of the strip mall there is a wine store and bar, so we grabbed 2 bottels of wine and  we went in and sat down( This is a BYOB place). We started off with an antipasto and bread and it was great. Loaded with ham, salami, prosciutto, capocollo, green beans artichoke hearts and fresh mozzarella and tomatoes. By this time the resaurant was getting busy. Also the owner came in about 6:45 or so and thats when things got fun. His name is Pasquale and he treats everybody like they are family. He is very nice and very funny. We started to notice that everyone there were regulars. And now we can seee why. I dont care what you say customer service is very important and it will keep people comming back. For dinner everyone tried something different so we could all try everything. I ordered the stuffed tortellini. It was stuffed with chicken, ricota cheese and in a tomato cream sauce. This sauce was friggin awesome. The linguini with clams in a  white sauce was delish. The meetballs, sausage & peppers was great and the stuffed peppers were to die for. My mom got the Chicken Parmigiana it was huge and it was great and very moist inside.   All the desserts are made fresh by Pasquale's wife. We tried the chocolate cake, tiramisu, and the cannoli. All the desserts were so good and you knew they were fresh. This place is a great little place and you will feel at home. Its small inside and not fancy at all, they except cash only and it is a BYOB restaurant. Great food and even better prices. If you meet Pasquale ask about his special apron, but only if your not easily offended. lol

qwCVpzpmVu2UQD2iwi-qaQ.text: From what I read on Yelp, I was expecting a great meal.  From the standpoint of an experience, Ristorante Giuseppe is fantastic.  It is a tiny family-owned place with an unforgettable wait staff.  Also, it's BYOB with no corkage fee, which is a huge plus in my eyes.  It feels like you're dining in someone's house, great family atmosphere.    The menu is very simple, your classical Italian fare.  Priced at about $15 an entree, I expected excellent food.  I had the cioppino and was very disappointed.  Granted, I spend half my time in the Bay Area and have access to the freshest seafood.  Still, this was clearly average ingredients being used.  Also, there was significantly too much pasta in my dish (as opposed to a True cioppino, which is more a seafood stew).  My group also ordered the chicken parmigiana (again, decent but not great) and the pork ribs parmigiana (a very interesting dish I had not seen before).  Also had the soup of the day which was excellent, the highlight of the food.  This is a good change of pace, a nice hole in the wall restaurant with a dedicated group of regulars who know the owners well.  However, the food is not as good as one might expect from previous Yelp reviews.  Maybe I caught them on a bad day, but I will not be returning anytime soon.  Also, it loses points from the shocking number of smokers right outside the restaurant.  We ate outside, and several guests regularly took smoke breaks about 12 feet from our table.  This was not the best complement to the dining experience.

pINx_huiEAlCCzQf2OD_yQ.text: My biggest gripe with this place is that the prices are so far out of whack with what you get.  This is a family owned strip mall restaurant that would be quite a find if the prices were about half of what they are.  The food here is pretty good but not the best I've ever had.  The place looks and feels like a budget Italian restaurant (plastic tablecloths, paper napkins, cheap furniture, cheesy decor).  The portions are pretty small too -- I'm a skinny guy but I was still hungry when I finished eating.  And yet, dinner for two (just two pasta entrees + soft drinks) cost north of $40 before the tip.  And yes, that's no appetizers, no salads, no deserts, and no exotic ingredients.  Just not worth the price they're charging.

98CTk8Kr1Be06dAyGQAFZw.text: The buzz of the microwave, the rude service, the pretentious cash only policy at a restaurant with 15.00 entrees, lots of syscofood product cans in eye view, The food here realy sucks, but if your lucky enough to get a kitchen view, all you will hear is the hum and dings of the microwave... The manager/server wen I asked him what he reccomended.. he got quite coindescending with me.."Never ask that question, they wil just push what is getting old"  what a complete douschbag.. I dined here 3 months ago.. saw this review, and had to speak my peace...

e5EkUXWc198Af8YKEdP7Dw.text: This place was amazing! After reading the reviews on here, I was nervous that I would get my hopes up and be let down.  So glad we decided to take a chance on this little hole in the wall. I have to say, this restaurant has the best pasta dishes I've had in the states.  I can honestly only recall one other pasta dish I had that was better, and that was in Florence, Italy. The waiter was great, very kind.  Service was incredibly prompt.  He made some great recommendations to us on which dish to choose. The atmosphere of the place is the only part where I think they might be able to improve, and they wouldn't have to do much.  It's still great- small, family owned/operated, byob was very fun; I just felt that if they perhaps dressed it up just a bit with the decor it would add more sparkle to this gem.  But I loved how it was so small, only a handful of tables, very relaxed and casual.  Overall- best Italian food in AZ, especially for the price.  I will absolutely be returning.

BDciaaVnlGkqg6M_AXPa_w.text: What a find.  In a strip mall nestled between a bank, clothing stores and overnight shipping is Giuseppe's.  A family owned and run establishment where byob is the way to go.  This reminds me of countless small mom and pop's back in The City.  The staff is friendly, the portions sizable and the check small to medium.  In fact, I can't believe I haven't reviewed this restaurant before.  Whether on a date, or with the family, I've never had a bad experience in the dozens of times I've been there.  From the veal parmagian (sp?) to the eggplant, from the fettucine to the spaghetti and meatbeals... mama mia.  It is a small venue, with very limited outdoors seating during good weather.  And the locals know about it, so it gets pretty packed Thursday through Sunday.  The salads and appetizers are delicious as well... If this restaurant had been in Spinal Tap, it would get "an eleven"...

Ye5qnlNxG0MWkxdtFg-Tuw.text: Molto bene!  If you want great, homemade Italian food just like mama used to make, this is your place.  The food is delicious and it's not expensive at all.  In fact, it's suprisingly affordable for how good it is.  It's just a little neighborhood Italian joint, and it's damn fine.  I think you can bring your own wine too, but I'm not positivo.  Call ahead and check, and ask about a corking fee too.  I just had a soda that night (I know, shocker!) but next time I will definitely be bringing some vino if that's really the case.  I had the tortellini and it was absolutely delish.  My boyfriend had ravioli that he loved, but I couldn't try it because it had meat in it.  We both had the homemade cannolis and they were worth every bite.   This is one of my new favorite restaurants, and I bet it's going to be yours too!

Jyqn6DiCnU1SH_MKXrZ8xQ.text: My husband and one year old son dined here on a Saturday night. Service was great, food was delicious, and the BYOB was much appreciated! Staff was very accomodating with our baby. :)

H4L4OrmmUBU6plPNNpTsbQ.text: We have been going to Guiseppes for YEARS.  Tonight, we went to celebrate my mothers birthday. It was six adults and five grandchildren.  I ha e not eaten here in about a year so we were happy to celebrate at one of our old favorites. When we got the bill, it seemed quite high. There was no itemized charges on the bill, in which never bothered us in the past,but since it seemed high, we all agreed to maybe ask the owner to itemize the bill. He did. And it didn't add up, in fact it was wrong. Instead of correcting the issue, he became very defensive and lashed out at us. When he added it himself he came up with three different totals. It made no sense, this definitely was not the same owner we remembered, patting our children on the heads, thanking customers proudly. This place has gone down hill, not only in the food, but the customer service and experience itself. We will never go bad. It went from an old favorite, to just, well, old news.

CctJJIp0wz-1MEbCoSlmAw.text: Food was great and the prices are reasonable.   I had Chicken parmigiana a meatball and an Italian salad.  I love the atmosphere of this  local family owned restaurant.  It reminds me of an old gangster movie with the checkered table clothes.

LmFIJnN0K9De7fUeJhgM5A.text: A great little ma and pa restaurante with big flavor!  The restaurant is small, very casual and I could tell the owners are very family oriented.   The entire family helps out at the place at some point or another and are very friendly and their hospitality was a nice change. The food however, was even better...   Alessandro's special is essentially a chicken piccata... the chicken was a bit dry, but the sauce was well prepared, it had just the right amount of citrus and capers and not overly sour or salty like most other places prepare it. The eggplant dish was awesome! Normally, the eggplant parmesan I get  is a little mushy, but it wasn't too dry or soggy here.   What else can I say? I love this place.

b-i9_J4b3kDQ7w7YWpJScA.text: I moved to central PHX 15 tears ago and fell in love with Giuseppe's Eggplant Parmesan subs when they were located on Indian School rd.  After moving several times and finally settling in to the 85254 neighborhood, I was elated to find the new Giuseppe's at the Scottsdale Rd/Thunderbird location. This place is THE BEST Italian restaurant this side of Chicago! You can pay more at the "other" Italian restaurant a few doors down, but nothing beats the family recipes at Giuseppe's that make these meals delectable.  Bottom line, this place makes the best sauce in town! The veal, the eggplant rolletini and the eggplant parmesan will all satisfy you and make you want to return again and again! Their desserts are mouth watering and their prices fair. The fact that you can bring your own bottle of wine with no cork fee is even better! I also LOVE the fact that the family is warm and friendly and speaks Italian to all of the other Italian families visiting the restaurant. This restaurant has a very Chicago/East Coast Italian feel....warm, inviting and mouth watering!!  PS-The Mrs. makes FABULOUS cannoli's!!   Mangia!!!

kqSpKywaJRxOpQYXNuRhpA.text: This is my favorite italian restaurant!! It's very authentic and all of their pastas are amazing! The meatballs are to die for, they are the size of tennis balls and i would definitely recommend ordering a couple of them. It's BYOB and you have to pay in cash. This is honestly the best pasta in scottsdale, definitely better than all of the overpriced, fancy italian restaurants.

HZV463QF723BZWe8vS6APQ.text: The best Italian around. i went a few weeks ago with my girlfriend (mainly because of the byob) we couldn't believe how great it was. i had an assortment  of home made pastas that were to die for. price i thought prices were a little high but reasonable  after realizing we drank our 30 dollar bottle of wine which would of cost us close to $75 if bought at a different restaurant,  not for the average fat American looking to throw down a pound of pasta and sauce.

v6ASkBRRTovqN_2FxXzIYg.text: I am a native New Yorker. We have been searching for mom and pop restaurants for 6 yrs. Although we are accustomed to the owner/mgr knowing us by name, knowing our likes and dislikes, ok, our (my) peculararities,,, this is as good as it gets. I am recovering from foot surgery. Guiseppe, sr and jr were so helpful, making sure my journey to and from the restroom were safe, i loved the ambiance, the prices are fair, the service friendly and genuous. THE FOOD IS AMAZING. We will be back.
